Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: The cost of your Policy depends on a range of factors, including but not limited to the type of cover, your age and sex, whether you smoke, the length of time you have had your Policy and how often you choose to pay your premiums. We may also take your occupation, health, income, personal pastimes, lifestyle, the number or type of Plans you hold across one or more policies, and other factors into account in determining insurance premium amounts.
ai_summary: The cost of your insurance policy is influenced by various factors, including the type of coverage, your age, sex, smoking status, policy duration, premium payment frequency, occupation, health, income, lifestyle, and the number and type of plans held. These elements collectively determine the premium amounts you will be required to pay.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: We ask for this information so that the premiums we charge take into account the different levels of risk presented by different customer groups. Sometimes discounts may apply to certain Plans; however, these may not apply for the full term of your Policy. Once we know a little bit about you and the cover you require, we can provide you with an indicative quote for your premium. The quoted premium may change once we have all the information we require to complete our Underwriting assessment. All premiums are payable in advance, by the due date shown in your Policy Schedule. We will inform you of the premium payable in subsequent years before each Policy anniversary.
ai_summary: This section explains that premiums are determined based on the risk levels associated with different customer groups, and while discounts may be available for certain Plans, they may not apply throughout the entire Policy term. An indicative quote for the premium can be provided once initial information is gathered, but the final premium may vary after the Underwriting assessment. All premiums must be paid in advance by the due date specified in the Policy Schedule, and the insurer will notify policyholders of the premium for subsequent years before each Policy anniversary.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Subheading: 1.3.1 You can choose to pay stepped or level premiums.
content:
Stepped premium
If you choose stepped premium, the premium is calculated based on your total Benefit Amount, the length of time you have had your Policy and your age as at each Policy anniversary. This means your premium will generally increase at each Policy anniversary. There are a range of other reasons why your stepped premium may increase, including if we change our premium rates. Please see section 1.3.2 and 1.3.3 below for more information.
ai_summary: Choosing a stepped premium means your premium will increase annually based on your total Benefit Amount, policy duration, and age at each anniversary. Additionally, other factors, such as changes in premium rates, may also result in increased costs; further details can be found in sections 1.3.2 and 1.3.3.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Subheading: 1.3.1 You can choose to pay stepped or level premiums.
content:
Level premium
Level premiums are not fixed. They can change. If you choose level premiums, the premium is based on your age at the Plan start date. Where you choose to increase your cover or the Inflation Protection Benefit applies, the premium rates used to calculate premiums for the alteration will be based on the Life Insured's age at that time. There are a range of other reasons why your level premium may increase, including if we change our premium rates. Please see sections 1.3.2 and 1.3.3 below for more information. Where level premium 'to age 65' is shown in your Policy Schedule, premiums will change to stepped premiums on the Policy anniversary before the Life Insured's 65th birthday. Where level premium 'to age 70' is shown in your Policy Schedule, premiums will change to stepped premiums on the Policy anniversary before the Life Insured's 70th birthday.
ai_summary: Level premiums can fluctuate and are determined by the Life Insured's age at the start of the Plan, with potential increases due to cover adjustments or changes in premium rates. If indicated as 'to age 65' or 'to age 70' in the Policy Schedule, these premiums will convert to stepped premiums on the anniversary prior to the Life Insured reaching 65 or 70, respectively.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
ai_summary: Premiums for both stepped and level policies may change due to various factors, including modifications to your policy (such as adding or removing benefits), changes in your Benefit Amount, adjustments in applicable discounts, shifts in government duties, or alterations in premium rates. Additionally, variations in other Accelerated Protection plans or policies you hold, such as changes in sums insured or the addition or cancellation of plans, can also impact your premiums.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: If your premiums change there may be options available to help you manage the cost of your cover, please speak to us or a financial adviser for assistance. Your Policy cannot be singled out for a change in how premium is charged because of an adverse change in the health or circumstances of the Life Insured after the Policy start date.
ai_summary: This section outlines that if your insurance premiums change, you may have options to manage these costs, and it is advisable to consult with your insurer or a financial adviser for guidance. Additionally, it clarifies that your policy cannot be individually adjusted based on any negative changes in the health or circumstances of the insured individual after the policy's inception.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Subheading: 1.3.3 We can change our premium rates
content: The cost of your cover is not guaranteed to remain the same each year. It can change for both stepped and level premium cover. In the past we have changed the premium rates used to calculate the cost of cover and Policy fees, including changing the premium rates we use to determine level premiums. We can change our Policy fees or the premium rates we use to determine your premium. However, the premium rates we use to determine your premiums are guaranteed not to change before the first Policy anniversary. Decisions to change premium rates or Policy fees do not occur because of changes to an individual customer’s own circumstances, but rather are determined in relation to the group of customers that we insure. We will act reasonably when making decisions to change our premium rates or Policy fees and will only make changes to the extent reasonably necessary to protect our legitimate business interests. Our premiums and Policy fees are determined so that the total premium and Policy fees for our group of insured customers is enough to cover our expected future claims costs, meeting our associated costs of doing business and margins in providing cover to you. We review associated factors on an ongoing basis which may include, but are by no means limited to, our assessment of regulatory or legislative requirements, our operating costs or the commercial environment. These are only some examples of factors that we may consider and others may apply. The outcome of any premium review performed by us may result in a change to the premium rates and Policy fees we charge you. If we change the premium rates or Policy fees, you will be advised of the change to your premiums or Policy fees at least 30 days before the change takes effect. If your premiums increase, you will always have the option to reduce the premium by reducing your cover, subject to any minimum premiums or sum insured applicable to your Policy. You will also always have the right to cancel your cover at any time and for any reason, including a premium increase. There may be other options available to help you manage the cost of your cover. Please speak to us or a financial adviser for assistance.
ai_summary: Premium rates for your insurance coverage are subject to change annually, affecting both stepped and level premium options. While rates are guaranteed not to change before the first policy anniversary, adjustments may occur based on collective customer assessments rather than individual circumstances. Changes are made to ensure the total premiums cover expected claims and operational costs, with customers notified at least 30 days prior to any adjustments. Policyholders can manage costs by reducing coverage or canceling their policy, and additional options may be available through consultation with the insurer or a financial adviser.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: We may pay commission or other remuneration (such as referral fees) to your financial adviser or other distributors of the Accelerated Protection product. Any amounts paid are factored into the cost of the Policy. Your financial adviser or the distributor will provide details of the payments they will receive from us in the Financial Services Guide and, if applicable statement of advice that they will give to you. In general, these amounts will be calculated by reference to your premium and will be subject to commission caps imposed by law.
ai_summary: Commissions or referral fees may be paid to your financial adviser or distributors of the Accelerated Protection product, and these costs are included in the Policy's total price. Details of these payments will be disclosed in the Financial Services Guide and any applicable statement of advice, with amounts typically based on your premium and subject to legal commission caps.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
The Policy fee is included as part of each premium instalment. The Policy fee will be increased on each Policy anniversary by the greater of the Indexation factor or three percent. The amount of the Policy fee depends on which premium frequency option is selected:

Premium frequency | Per instalment | Annual equivalent
---|---|---
Yearly | $88.00 | $88.00
Half-Yearly | $44.00 | $88.00
Quarterly | $24.00 | $96.00
Monthly | $8.00 | $96.00
ai_summary: The Policy fee, included in each premium installment, increases annually by the greater of the Indexation factor or three percent. The fee varies based on the selected premium frequency, with yearly payments at $88, half-yearly at $44, quarterly at $24, and monthly at $8, all reflecting an annual equivalent of either $88 or $96 depending on the frequency chosen.

Payment frequency options include monthly (excluding BPAY), quarterly, half-yearly, and annually, with potential premium frequency discounts applicable for certain intervals.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
Life Insurance only applies if indicated in the Policy Schedule.
A benefit under Life Insurance will only be paid if death or Terminal Illness occurs after the Plan start date and before the Plan end date.
When we refer to a benefit payment, the statement is made on the basis that the benefit referred to is payable under the terms and conditions of the Policy. We will not pay a benefit if an exclusion applies. You must also satisfy our claim requirements, explained in Section 3.
ai_summary: Life Insurance coverage is contingent upon its inclusion in the Policy Schedule and is payable only if death or Terminal Illness occurs between the Plan start and end dates. Benefit payments are subject to the Policy's terms and conditions, and exclusions may apply; claimants must also meet specific requirements outlined in Section 3.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
Death Benefit
The Benefit Amount is payable when the Life Insured dies.
Terminal Illness Benefit
The Benefit Amount is payable when the Life Insured is diagnosed as Terminally Ill.
If the Terminal Illness Benefit is paid, we will cancel any Attached or Linked Plans.
ai_summary: The insurance document outlines two key benefits under the Accelerated Protection plan: the Death Benefit, which pays the Benefit Amount upon the death of the Life Insured, and the Terminal Illness Benefit, which provides the Benefit Amount if the Life Insured is diagnosed with a terminal illness. It is important to note that if the Terminal Illness Benefit is claimed, any Attached or Linked Plans will be canceled.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
Advanced Payment Benefit
The Advanced Payment Benefit is an advance payment of 10% of the Benefit Amount, up to a maximum of $25,000. This benefit will be paid when the death certificate or a medical certificate confirming death of the Life Insured is provided to us.
In the first three years from the Plan start date, the Advanced Payment Benefit will only be paid if the Life Insured's death resulted from an Accident. After the first three years, the Advanced Payment Benefit will apply for all causes of death unless the cause of death is excluded.
Payment of the Advanced Payment Benefit does not mean any admission or acceptance of any claim or liability regarding current or future payments under Life Insurance.
If we pay the Advanced Payment Benefit and our assessment of the claim determines that the Death Benefit will not be paid due to breach of the duty to take reasonable care not to make a misrepresentation, we will require the Advanced Payment Benefit to be repaid to us.
If the Advanced Payment Benefit is paid, it will reduce the Benefit Amount by the amount paid under the Advanced Payment Benefit.
ai_summary: The Advanced Payment Benefit allows for an advance payment of 10% of the Benefit Amount, up to $25,000, upon receipt of a death certificate or medical certificate confirming the Life Insured's death. Within the first three years of the plan, this benefit is only applicable if the death results from an accident; thereafter, it covers all causes of death, barring exclusions. However, payment does not imply acceptance of liability for future claims, and if a claim is denied due to misrepresentation, the advanced amount must be repaid. Additionally, any payment made under this benefit will reduce the overall Benefit Amount.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: If the Life Insured dies outside Australia, we will increase the maximum amount payable under the Advanced Payment Benefit to 10% of the Benefit Amount up to a maximum of $35,000. This benefit will be paid when the death certificate or a certified medical certificate by a Medical Practitioner, confirming death of the Life Insured outside of Australia is provided to us. All other terms and conditions of the Advanced Payment Benefit apply to the Repatriation Benefit.
ai_summary: The Repatriation Benefit under the Accelerated Protection policy increases the Advanced Payment Benefit to 10% of the Benefit Amount, capped at $35,000, if the Life Insured dies outside Australia. This benefit is payable upon submission of a death certificate or a certified medical certificate confirming the death, while all other terms and conditions of the Advanced Payment Benefit remain applicable.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
No payments will be made under Life Insurance, and any included or optional benefits (if applicable), if the claim arises directly or indirectly because of an intentional, self-inflicted act by the Life Insured:
• within 13 months after the Plan start date;
• within 13 months after the date of any increase applied for, but only in respect of the increase amount; and
• within 13 months after the most recent date we agreed to reinstate either the Plan or Policy.
We will waive the above exclusion if you had death cover on the Life Insured that was in force for at least 13 consecutive months immediately before the Plan start date (without the death cover being cancelled and/or reinstated) with TAL or another insurer, and you have replaced the death cover with Life Insurance under this Policy. The waiver will only apply up to the level of death cover you had with TAL or the other insurer.
If the Life Insurance Plan is reinstated, the exclusion above will recommence from the date of reinstatement.
Any cover bought back under the Death Buy-Back Option or Death Buy-Back Benefit will be issued subject to the limitations and conditions, exclusions and loadings which were applicable to the original Policy. If Accelerated Protection is no longer available when the Death Buy-Back Option or Death Buy-Back Benefit is exercised, we will issue a death cover comparable to Accelerated Protection Life Insurance. Any additional benefits under the new death cover which are not available with Accelerated Protection Life Insurance will not apply.
ai_summary: Payments under the Life Insurance policy will not be made for claims resulting from intentional self-inflicted acts within 13 months of the plan start date, any increase in coverage, or reinstatement of the policy, unless the insured had continuous death cover for at least 13 months prior with TAL or another insurer, which can waive this exclusion. If the policy is reinstated, the exclusion restarts, and any coverage obtained through the Death Buy-Back Option will adhere to the original policy's conditions and limitations, with comparable coverage provided if Accelerated Protection is unavailable.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
ai_summary: Life Insurance under the Plan terminates on the earlier of several conditions, including the policy anniversary before the Life Insured's 100th birthday or 75th birthday (if through TAL Super), cancellation by the Policy Owner, non-payment of premiums, misrepresentation, death of the Life Insured, or when the full Benefit Amount is paid. If structured through a retail superannuation fund, coverage ends upon ceasing membership. Policy Owners may apply within 60 days of cancellation to continue the Plan without further medical or financial requirements, retaining any special conditions from the original Plan.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: This page contains a large image of a man in a wetsuit holding a surfboard, looking towards the right with a smile. The background appears to be a beach or dunes under a clear sky. A footer at the bottom reads 'Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document 35'.
ai_summary: The image on this page visually represents the theme of life insurance, featuring a man in a wetsuit, symbolizing the adventurous spirit of life. However, the content does not provide specific details regarding the conditions, benefits, or requirements related to when life insurance ends, as it primarily consists of a visual element without accompanying text. For comprehensive information, refer to the Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
TPD Insurance only applies if indicated in the Policy Schedule. The TPD definition and any applicable options are shown in the Policy Schedule.
A benefit under TPD Insurance will only be paid if the conditions and requirements for a claimable event are met after the Plan start date and before the Plan end date.
When we refer to a benefit payment, the statement is made on the basis that the benefit referred to is payable under the terms and conditions of the Policy. You must also satisfy our claim requirements, explained in Section 3.
ai_summary: TPD Insurance is applicable only if specified in the Policy Schedule, which outlines the definition and options available. Benefits are payable only if the claim conditions are met between the Plan start and end dates, and all claim requirements detailed in Section 3 must be satisfied for payment to be issued.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
TPD Benefit
The TPD Benefit is payable if the Life Insured becomes Totally and Permanently Disabled. The applicable TPD definition is shown in the Policy Schedule.
The following TPD definitions are available:
• ‘Any Occupation’;
• ‘Own Occupation’ (not available when structured through superannuation); or
• Activities of Daily Living (ADL).
If the TPD Benefit is paid, it will reduce the Benefit Amount of any Attached and/or Linked Plans by the amount paid.
ai_summary: The Total and Permanent Disability (TPD) Benefit is payable if the Life Insured becomes Totally and Permanently Disabled, with definitions available as 'Any Occupation,' 'Own Occupation' (not applicable when structured through superannuation), or based on Activities of Daily Living (ADL). Payment of the TPD Benefit will reduce the Benefit Amount of any Attached and/or Linked Plans by the amount disbursed.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
Advanced Payment Benefit
Not available when structured through superannuation.
We will pay 25% of the Benefit Amount, up to a maximum of $500,000 if the Life Insured suffers one of the following:
• Loss of use of a Single Limb (permanent); or
• Loss of Sight in One Eye (permanent).
This is only payable once and the TPD Insurance Benefit Amount and the Benefit Amount under any Attached or Linked Plan, will be reduced by the amount paid under the Advanced Payment Benefit.
ai_summary: The Advanced Payment Benefit allows for a one-time payment of 25% of the Benefit Amount, capped at $500,000, if the Life Insured experiences permanent loss of use of a single limb or permanent loss of sight in one eye. This benefit is not available if the insurance is structured through superannuation and will reduce the Total Permanent Disability (TPD) Insurance Benefit Amount and any related benefits by the amount paid.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
Death Benefit
Only available with Standalone TPD Insurance structured through TAL Super.
If the TPD Benefit has not been paid and the Life Insured dies, we will pay the lesser of $10,000 and the TPD Insurance Benefit Amount.
ai_summary: The Death Benefit, available exclusively with Standalone Total Permanent Disability (TPD) Insurance through TAL Super, stipulates that if the TPD Benefit has not been paid at the time of the Life Insured's death, a payment will be made for the lesser of $10,000 or the TPD Insurance Benefit Amount.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
The options listed below only apply if indicated in your Policy Schedule.
Death Buy-Back Option
Only available if TPD Insurance is Linked or Attached to Life Insurance.
If we pay 100% of the TPD Insurance Benefit Amount, TPD Insurance will end. When this occurs, under the Death Buy-Back Option, you can buy-back Life Insurance on the Life Insured.
The amount of cover you may repurchase is the amount of the TPD Insurance Benefit Amount paid. The Death Buy-Back Option can be exercised without having to provide evidence of health, occupation, income or pastimes, or any other Underwriting information.
You must notify us in writing of your intention to exercise the Death Buy-Back Option. Notification must occur during the 30 days following the 12-month anniversary of the date we were notified formally of a claim in accordance with our claim requirements (see Section 3), and in relation to a claim which was subsequently paid. Any further requirements must be submitted to us within 30 days of the date we received your notification, or the Death Buy-Back Option will expire.
If payment of the claim occurs more than 12 months after the formal notification was made to us, buy-back will be available for 30 days from the date of payment. If you fail to exercise the Death Buy-Back during this 30-day period, the Death Buy-Back Option will expire.
The Death Buy-Back Option will expire if not exercised before the Policy anniversary before the Life Insured’s 65th birthday.
The premium for the repurchased Life Insurance will be calculated using our standard premium rates for the age of the Life Insured at the time the option is exercised and will take into account any extra premiums charged and special provisions that apply to the Life Insurance Plan for the Life Insured.
The repurchased Life Insurance will not be eligible for the following benefits and options:
• Inflation Protection Benefit;
• Guaranteed Future Insurability Benefit;
• Premium Relief Option; or
• Business Insurance Option (if applicable).
The Death Buy-Back Option does not apply where ‘Double TPD’ or ‘Double Critical Illness’ is shown in your Policy Schedule.
ai_summary: The Death Buy-Back Option allows policyholders to repurchase Life Insurance equivalent to the TPD Insurance Benefit Amount paid, provided TPD Insurance is linked to Life Insurance. This option must be exercised within 30 days following the 12-month anniversary of a claim notification, or within 30 days of claim payment if it occurs after 12 months. The option expires if not utilized before the policy anniversary prior to the Life Insured's 65th birthday. Premiums for the repurchased Life Insurance will be based on standard rates at the time of exercise, and certain benefits, such as Inflation Protection and Guaranteed Future Insurability, will not apply to the repurchased coverage.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
ai_summary: The Double TPD Option is available when TPD Insurance is linked to Life Insurance, allowing the full TPD benefit to be paid without reducing the Life Insurance Benefit. Future premiums for the Life Insurance portion equal to the TPD amount paid will be waived, and coverage continues until the plan's end date. However, this waived portion will not qualify for benefits such as Inflation Protection or Guaranteed Future Insurability. This option expires on the policy anniversary before the insured turns 65.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
Superlink TPD allows you to structure TPD Insurance as follows:
• TPD ‘Any Occupation’ definition structured through superannuation; and
• TPD ‘Own Occupation’ definition structured outside superannuation.
Two Policies will be issued, one of which will be issued to the trustee of a superannuation fund, and the other will be issued outside of superannuation. These policies will be Linked and the following additional conditions apply:
• the TPD Insurance Benefit Amount, any optional benefits selected, and any loadings or exclusions (if applicable) of each Policy must always be the same;
• if TPD Insurance is reduced or increased under one Policy, TPD Insurance on the other Policy will be reduced or increased (as applicable) at the same time;
• if the Policy structured through superannuation is cancelled (not because of a claim payment), the Policy structured outside superannuation will also be cancelled unless you notify us in writing to retain the Plan structured outside superannuation before cancellation;
• if TPD Insurance structured outside superannuation is cancelled, cover will continue under the Policy structured through superannuation, and Superlink TPD will no longer apply; and
• the maximum benefits payable under both Policies will never exceed that which would be payable under a single TPD Policy.
Claims will first be assessed using the ‘Any Occupation’ definition under TPD Insurance Plan structured through superannuation and the SIS definition of Permanent Incapacity. If these definitions are satisfied the Benefit Amount will be paid to the trustee. If these definitions are not satisfied, the claim will be assessed using the ‘Own Occupation’ definition under the TPD Insurance Plan structured outside superannuation and any Benefit Amount payable will be paid to the Policy Owner.
The Policy Schedules will indicate if Superlink TPD applies.
ai_summary: Superlink TPD allows for the structuring of Total Permanent Disability (TPD) Insurance with two policies: one under the 'Any Occupation' definition through superannuation and another under the 'Own Occupation' definition outside superannuation. These linked policies must maintain identical benefit amounts and conditions, and any changes to one policy will affect the other. Claims are assessed first under the superannuation policy; if unsuccessful, the outside policy is then evaluated. Cancellation of the superannuation policy results in the cancellation of the outside policy unless otherwise notified, while cancellation of the outside policy allows the superannuation policy to remain active. The total benefits from both policies cannot exceed that of a single TPD policy.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
No payment will be made under TPD insurance and any included or optional benefits (if applicable) if the claim arises directly or indirectly because of an intentional, self-inflicted act by the Life Insured.
If TPD Insurance is Attached or Linked to Life Insurance, the TPD Benefit will not be paid if you are also eligible for the Terminal Illness Benefit under Life Insurance.
If TPD Insurance is not Attached or Linked to Life Insurance, no payment will be made under TPD Insurance unless the Life Insured survives the Sickness or Injury which resulted in Total and Permanent Disability, for at least 14 days.
ai_summary: Payments under Total and Permanent Disability (TPD) insurance will not be made for claims resulting from intentional self-inflicted acts by the Life Insured. If TPD insurance is linked to Life Insurance, benefits will not be paid if the insured is also eligible for the Terminal Illness Benefit. Additionally, if TPD insurance is not linked to Life Insurance, the Life Insured must survive the qualifying Sickness or Injury for at least 14 days to receive benefits.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
ai_summary: TPD Insurance coverage will terminate upon the earliest occurrence of several events: the policy anniversary prior to the Life Insured's 65th birthday, a written cancellation request from the Policy Owner, non-payment of premiums, cancellation due to misrepresentation or fraudulent claims, the death of the Life Insured, or when the full Benefit Amount is paid or reduced to nil. Notably, even after the Benefit Amount is settled, the Financial Planning Benefit and Grief Support Benefit will remain accessible for 12 months.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
The following conditions also apply to TPD Insurance:
• If TPD Insurance is Attached to Life Insurance or Critical Illness Insurance will also cancel TPD Insurance unless you tell us in writing that you want to retain TPD Insurance as a Standalone Plan. The terms and conditions for Standalone TPD Insurance will apply.
• If TPD Insurance is Linked to Life Insurance, TPD Insurance will become a Standalone Plan if you cancel Life Insurance.
• If TPD Insurance and Critical Illness Insurance are both Attached to Life Insurance and you cancel Life Insurance, both TPD Insurance and Critical Illness Insurance will also be cancelled unless you tell us in writing that you want to retain either or both TPD Insurance and/or Critical Illness Insurance. If you choose to keep both TPD Insurance and Critical Illness Insurance, the TPD Insurance will be Attached to Critical Illness Insurance. If the TPD Insurance Benefit Amount is greater than the Critical Illness Insurance Benefit Amount, the Attached TPD Insurance Benefit Amount will be reduced so that it is not greater than the Critical Illness Insurance Benefit Amount and the remainder of the TPD Insurance Benefit Amount can be setup as a Standalone TPD Insurance Plan.
ai_summary: The TPD Insurance has specific conditions: it will be canceled if attached to Life or Critical Illness Insurance unless you request in writing to retain it as a Standalone Plan. If TPD Insurance is linked to Life Insurance and that is canceled, TPD Insurance becomes standalone. Additionally, if both TPD and Critical Illness Insurance are attached to Life Insurance and it is canceled, both will also be canceled unless you specify in writing to retain either or both. If retained, TPD Insurance will be attached to Critical Illness Insurance, and if the TPD Benefit Amount exceeds the Critical Illness Benefit Amount, it will be adjusted to match, with any excess set up as a Standalone TPD Insurance Plan.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: If you cancel a Plan but choose to keep at least one of the Plans that was Attached or Linked, your premium rates will change for the remaining Plan(s). The premium will be calculated using our premium rates for the age of the Life Insured at the time of the change and will take into account any extra premiums charged and special provisions that apply to the original Plan. Any changes that increase our liability to pay claims will require full Underwriting.
ai_summary: If you cancel a Plan but retain at least one Attached or Linked Plan, your premium rates for the remaining Plan(s) will be adjusted based on the Life Insured's age at the time of the change, incorporating any additional premiums and special provisions from the original Plan. Furthermore, any modifications that increase the insurer's liability for claims will necessitate full Underwriting.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: When structured through a retail superannuation fund, TPD Insurance will end when you cease to be a member of the retail superannuation fund. This means that your Policy will be cancelled from the date you cease to be a member of the retail superannuation fund. You can apply within 60 days of the date your Policy was cancelled to continue the Plan with no further medical or financial requirement. Any special conditions or loadings which applied to the original Plan will also apply to the new Plan.
ai_summary: When TPD Insurance is structured through a retail superannuation fund, it terminates upon ceasing membership in that fund, resulting in policy cancellation. However, individuals can apply within 60 days of cancellation to continue their coverage without additional medical or financial requirements, with any existing special conditions or loadings carried over to the new plan.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
Critical Illness Insurance only applies if indicated in the Policy Schedule. Critical Illness Insurance is available as 'Standard' or Premier'. The type of Critical Illness Insurance and any applicable options is stated in your Policy Schedule. Critical Illness Insurance cannot be structured through superannuation.
A benefit under Critical Illness Insurance will only be paid if the conditions and requirements for a claimable event are met after the Plan start date but before the Plan end date and the Life Insured suffers a specified serious event as described in the sections below. We require confirmation of diagnosis by a Medical Practitioner and the specified severity threshold criteria to be met, for a benefit to be payable. The severity threshold criteria are defined for each event in Section 9.
For many specified serious events this means the condition will be required to progress beyond a diagnosis, where diagnosis means the process of a Medical Practitioner determining which Sickness or Injury explains an individual's symptoms. You must also satisfy our claim requirements in Section 3 of this PDS.
When we refer to a benefit payment, the statement is made on the basis that the benefit referred to is payable under the terms and conditions of the Policy.
ai_summary: Critical Illness Insurance, available as 'Standard' or 'Premier', is only applicable if specified in the Policy Schedule and cannot be structured through superannuation. Benefits are payable for specified serious events occurring between the Plan start and end dates, contingent upon meeting defined severity thresholds and obtaining a diagnosis from a Medical Practitioner. Claim requirements outlined in Section 3 must also be satisfied for a benefit payment to be issued, emphasizing that conditions must progress beyond mere diagnosis to qualify for claims.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: The following benefits, in addition to the benefits set out in Section 2.4, are included in Critical Illness Insurance Standard and Premier, unless otherwise indicated.
ai_summary: Section 2.3.1 outlines that Critical Illness Insurance, both Standard and Premier, includes additional benefits beyond those specified in Section 2.4, unless stated otherwise. These benefits are designed to provide financial support upon diagnosis of specified critical illnesses, ensuring policyholders receive comprehensive coverage tailored to their needs.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
The Benefit Amount is payable if the Life Insured suffers a Critical Illness Event listed in the table below.
If the Life Insured suffers more than one Critical Illness Event, the Benefit Amount is only payable for the first occurring Critical Illness Event, unless the first to occur is Angioplasty. If Angioplasty occurs and a claim is paid, the remaining Benefit Amount will be the basis used to determine payment in accordance with the Critical Illness insurance terms and conditions if the Life Insured suffers another Critical Illness Event.
More than one payment can be made for Angioplasty, as long as the first Angioplasty procedure ever undergone by the Life Insured occurred after the Plan start date.
ai_summary: The Critical Illness Benefit provides a specified Benefit Amount if the Life Insured experiences a listed Critical Illness Event, with payment applicable only for the first event unless it is Angioplasty. In cases of Angioplasty, multiple payments can be made if the first procedure occurs after the Plan start date, and any subsequent Critical Illness claims will be based on the remaining Benefit Amount after the initial Angioplasty payment.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
The following conditions apply to Critical Illness Insurance Standard Plan for Angioplasty:
• each Angioplasty procedure occurring at least six months after the previous Angioplasty; and
• a maximum of three payments.
ai_summary: The Critical Illness Insurance Standard Plan for Angioplasty stipulates that benefits are payable for each Angioplasty procedure performed at least six months apart, with a maximum of three payments allowed per insured individual.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: If the Critical Illness Benefit is paid, it will reduce the Critical Illness Insurance Benefit Amount and the Benefit Amount of any Attached and/or Linked Plans, by the amount paid.
ai_summary: The Critical Illness Benefit, when paid out, will decrease both the Critical Illness Insurance Benefit Amount and the Benefit Amount of any Attached and/or Linked Plans by the amount disbursed. This reduction is a key condition of the benefit payout.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Subheading: Critical Illness Events applicable to Standard and Premier
content:
Heart conditions
* Angioplasty¹,²
* Angioplasty for Triple Vessel Disease¹
* Aortic Surgery (for specified conditions)
* Cardiomyopathy (permanent)
* Heart Attack (of specified severity)¹
* Heart Valve Surgery¹
* Coronary Artery Bypass Surgery¹
* Open Heart Surgery¹
* Out of Hospital Cardiac Arrest (requiring cardiopulmonary resuscitation)¹
* Idiopathic Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension (of specified severity)

Neurological conditions
* Coma (of specified severity)¹
* Dementia including Alzheimer’s Disease (permanent)
* Encephalitis (resulting in permanent neurological deficit)
* Major Head Trauma (with permanent neurological deficit)
* Meningitis (resulting in permanent neurological deficit)
* Meningococcal Septicaemia (resulting in significant permanent impairment)
* Multiple Sclerosis (with multiple episodes of neurological deficit and persisting neurological abnormalities)¹
* Muscular Dystrophy
* Paralysis (permanent)
* Parkinson’s Disease (permanent)
* Progressive and Debilitating Motor Neurone Disease
* Stroke (resulting in neurological deficit)¹

Permanent conditions
* Blindness (permanent)
* Deafness (permanent)
* Loss of Independent Existence (permanent)
* Loss of use of Limbs (permanent)
* Loss of Speech (permanent)

Organ disorders
* Chronic Kidney Failure (undergoing permanent dialysis)
* Chronic Liver Failure (resulting in permanent symptoms)
* Chronic Lung Failure (on permanent oxygen therapy)
* Major Organ Transplant (of specified organs)
* Pneumonectomy
* Severe Burns (covering at least 20% of the body’s surface area)

Blood disorders
* Aplastic Anaemia (requiring treatment)
* Medically-Acquired HIV (contracted from a medical procedure or operation)
* Occupationally-Acquired HIV

Cancer
* Benign Brain Tumour (resulting in irreversible neurological deficit)¹
* Cancer (of specified criteria)¹
ai_summary: Section 2.3 of the insurance document outlines the Critical Illness Insurance coverage for Standard and Premier plans, detailing various critical illness events. These include heart conditions such as heart attacks and surgeries, neurological disorders like stroke and dementia, permanent conditions including blindness and paralysis, organ disorders such as chronic kidney and liver failure, blood disorders like aplastic anemia, and specific cancer diagnoses. Each condition is subject to specified criteria and severity levels to qualify for coverage, ensuring comprehensive protection against significant health risks.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document

content:
Organ disorders

Blood disorders

ai_summary: Section 2.3 of the insurance document outlines critical illness events covered under the Premier plan, specifically highlighting two categories: organ disorders, which include Severe Diabetes Mellitus of specified severity, and blood disorders, which encompass Occupationally-Acquired Hepatitis B or C. These conditions are essential for policyholders to understand as they determine eligibility for critical illness benefits.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:

ai_summary: The Critical Illness Benefit includes a three-month qualifying period, with specific exclusions outlined in Section 2.3.4. In cases related to the Needlestick Benefit, the payout is limited to 25% of the total Benefit amount, capped at a maximum of $50,000.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
If the Life Insured suffers Paralysis (permanent), the Critical Illness Insurance payment will be:
• two times the Benefit Amount, to a maximum of $2,000,000; or
• the Benefit Amount, if it is greater than $2,000,000.
If the Paralysis Support Benefit is paid, it will reduce the Benefit Amount of any Attached or Linked Plans by the Critical Illness Insurance Benefit Amount.
The repurchased Life Insurance will not be eligible for increases under the Inflation Protection Benefit, Guaranteed Future Insurability Benefit, or Business Insurance Option (if applicable).
ai_summary: The Paralysis Support Benefit under Critical Illness Insurance provides a payment of either two times the Benefit Amount, up to a maximum of $2,000,000, or the Benefit Amount if it exceeds $2,000,000, in the event of permanent paralysis. Payment of this benefit will reduce the Benefit Amount of any Attached or Linked Plans by the amount received, and any repurchased Life Insurance will not qualify for increases under the Inflation Protection Benefit, Guaranteed Future Insurability Benefit, or Business Insurance Option.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
Only available when Critical Illness Insurance is Attached or Linked to Life Insurance.
If we pay 100% of the Critical Illness Benefit, Paralysis Support Benefit or TPD Benefit, Critical Illness Insurance will end. When this occurs, under the Death Buy-Back Benefit, you can repurchase Life Insurance on the Life Insured. The amount you can repurchase is the amount of Critical Illness Benefit paid or the Benefit Amount, in the case of the Paralysis Support Benefit. The Death Buy-Back Benefit can be exercised without having to provide evidence of health, occupation, income or pastimes, or any other Underwriting information.
You must notify us in writing of your intention to exercise the Death Buy-Back Benefit during the 30 days after the 12 month anniversary of the date we were notified formally of a claim in accordance with our claim requirements (see Section 3) in relation to a claim which was subsequently paid. Any further requirements must be submitted to us within 30 days of the date we received your notification or the Death Buy-Back Benefit will expire.
If payment of the claim occurs more than 12 months after the formal notification was made to us, repurchase will be available for 30 days from the date of payment. If you fail to exercise the Death Buy-Back during this 30 day period, the Death-Buy Back Benefit will expire.
The Death Buy-Back Benefit will expire if not exercised before the Policy anniversary before the Life Insured’s 70th birthday.
The premium for the repurchased Life Insurance will be calculated using our standard premium rates for the age of the Life Insured at the time the option is exercised and will take into account any extra premiums charged and special provisions that apply to the Life Insurance Plan for the Life Insured.
The Death Buy-Back Benefit does not apply:
• unless Critical Illness Insurance is Attached or Linked to Life Insurance; or
• when ‘Double Critical Illness’ or ‘Double TPD’ is shown in your Policy Schedule.
ai_summary: The Death Buy-Back Benefit allows the repurchase of Life Insurance after the full payment of Critical Illness, Paralysis Support, or Total Permanent Disability Benefits, provided that the Critical Illness Insurance is linked to Life Insurance. This benefit can be exercised without additional underwriting requirements within 30 days following the 12-month anniversary of a claim notification or within 30 days after claim payment if it exceeds 12 months. The option expires before the policy anniversary preceding the Life Insured's 70th birthday, and premiums for the repurchased Life Insurance will be based on standard rates for the Life Insured's age at the time of exercise. The benefit is not applicable if 'Double Critical Illness' or 'Double TPD' is indicated in the

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: The following benefits only apply if ‘Premier’ is shown in your Policy Schedule.

These benefits provide enhanced coverage and support, but eligibility is contingent upon the specific designation of 'Premier' in the policy documentation.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:

ai_summary: The Advancement Benefit under Critical Illness Insurance provides varying maximum payments for specific permanent conditions: 10% of the Benefit Amount (up to $100,000) for permanent loss of hearing in one ear, limb use, or sight in one eye; 25% (up to $100,000) for specified carcinomas, benign brain tumors, early-stage cancers, and dementia; and 20% (up to $100,000) for Type 1 diabetes diagnosed after age 30. A three-month qualifying period applies to certain conditions, including specified carcinomas and cancers.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: The Female Critical Illness Benefit will be payable upon the occurrence of a Female Critical Illness Benefit Event listed in the table below and only apply if the Life Insured is female. The payment for each event is 20% of the Benefit Amount, up to a maximum of $50,000. Each Female Critical Illness Benefit Event can only be paid once. If the Female Critical Illness Benefit is paid, it will reduce the Critical Illness Insurance Benefit Amount and the Benefit Amount of any Attached or Linked Plans by the amount paid.
ai_summary: The Female Critical Illness Benefit provides a payment of 20% of the Benefit Amount, capped at $50,000, upon the diagnosis of a specified Female Critical Illness Event for female Life Insureds. Each event is eligible for a one-time payment, which will reduce both the Critical Illness Insurance Benefit Amount and the Benefit Amount of any Attached or Linked Plans by the amount disbursed.

ai_summary: The Female Critical Illness Benefit under the Critical Illness Insurance covers specific events such as pregnancy complications (e.g., eclampsia, ectopic pregnancy), congenital abnormalities (e.g., Down’s Syndrome, spina bifida), and other severe conditions (e.g., severe osteoporosis, lupus). For congenital abnormalities, the conditions must arise after the insurance plan's start date, and the child must survive at least 30 days post-birth to qualify for benefits.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
Coverage for Pregnancy Complications and Congenital Abnormalities ends at the Policy anniversary before the Life Insured’s 45th birthday. No payments will be made for Pregnancy Complications or Congenital Abnormalities:
• within 12 months after the Plan start date;
• within 12 months after the date of an approved applied-for increase but only in respect of the increase; and
• within 12 months after the most recent date we agreed to reinstate either the Plan or Policy.
No payments will be made for ‘Other events’ (listed in the table above):
• within three months after the Plan start date;
• within three months after the date of an applied-for increase but only in respect of the increase; and
• within three months after the most recent date we agreed to reinstate either the Plan or Policy.
ai_summary: The Female Critical Illness Benefit under the Critical Illness Insurance policy provides coverage for Pregnancy Complications and Congenital Abnormalities until the policy anniversary before the insured turns 45. However, no payments will be made for these conditions within 12 months of the policy's start date, any approved increase, or reinstatement. Additionally, payments for 'Other events' are excluded within three months of the policy's start date, any increase, or reinstatement.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: If the occupation class of the Life Insured is AA+ as specified in the Policy Schedule, the Needlestick Benefit will be payable when the Life Insured suffers Occupationally-Acquired Hepatitis B or C. The amount payable is the Benefit Amount, to a maximum of $1 million across all policies issued by TAL in the event of Occupationally-Acquired Hepatitis B or C.
ai_summary: The Needlestick Benefit under the Critical Illness Insurance is applicable to Life Insured individuals classified as AA+ in the Policy Schedule, providing a payout of up to $1 million for Occupationally-Acquired Hepatitis B or C, applicable across all TAL-issued policies.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
2.3.3 Optional benefits
The options listed below only apply if indicated in your Policy Schedule.
Double Critical Illness Option
Only available if Critical Illness Insurance is Attached or Linked to Life Insurance.
The Life Insured must survive a Critical Illness Event for at least 14 days to be eligible to claim under this option.
If the Double Critical Illness Option is indicated in your Policy Schedule, and 100% of the Critical Illness Insurance Benefit Amount becomes payable:
• the Life Insurance Benefit Amount will not be reduced;
• all future premiums due in respect of that part of the Life Insurance Benefit Amount equal to the Critical Illness Insurance Benefit Amount paid will be waived; and
• the Life Insurance Benefit Amount equal to the Critical Illness Insurance Benefit Amount paid will continue until the Life Insurance Plan end date.
The portion of Life Insurance where the premiums are waived will not be eligible for the following benefits and options:
• Inflation Protection Benefit;
• Guaranteed Future Insurability Benefit;
• Premium Relief Option; or
• Business Insurance Option (if applicable).
The Double Critical Illness Option will expire on the Policy anniversary before the Life Insured’s 70th birthday.
ai_summary: The Double Critical Illness Option is an optional benefit available only if Critical Illness Insurance is linked to Life Insurance, requiring the Life Insured to survive a Critical Illness Event for at least 14 days to claim. If selected, upon a claim where 100% of the Critical Illness Insurance Benefit Amount is paid, the Life Insurance Benefit Amount remains intact, future premiums for the equivalent Life Insurance portion are waived, and coverage continues until the policy's end date; however, this portion will not qualify for benefits like Inflation Protection or Guaranteed Future Insurability. This option expires on the policy anniversary before the Life Insured turns 70.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
If we pay a Critical Illness Benefit, Advancement Benefit, Needlestick Benefit, or Female Critical Illness Benefit, the Critical Illness Insurance Benefit Amount will reduce by the amount paid. The Critical Illness Reinstatement Option allows you to repurchase this amount of Critical Illness cover on the Life Insured. The repurchased cover will be the same type of Critical Illness cover held immediately before the claim.
The Critical Illness Reinstatement Option can be exercised without having to provide evidence of health, occupation, income or pastimes, or any other Underwriting information.
You must notify us in writing of your intention to exercise the Critical Illness Reinstatement Option. Notification must occur during the 30 days following the 12-month anniversary of the date we were notified formally of a claim, and in relation to a claim which was subsequently paid. Any further requirements must be submitted to us within 30 days of the date we received your notification, or the Critical Illness Reinstatement Option will expire. If payment of the claim occurs more than 12 months after the formal notification was made to us, reinstatement will be available for 30 days from the date of payment. If you fail to exercise the Critical Illness Reinstatement Option in the prescribed period, the Critical Illness Reinstatement Option will expire.
The Critical Illness Reinstatement Option will expire on the Policy anniversary before the Life Insured’s 65th birthday.
ai_summary: The Critical Illness Reinstatement Option allows policyholders to repurchase the Critical Illness Insurance Benefit Amount reduced by any claims paid, without needing to provide health or underwriting information. To exercise this option, written notification must be submitted within 30 days following the 12-month anniversary of the claim notification, and any additional requirements must be fulfilled within 30 days of notification; otherwise, the option will expire. This reinstatement is available until the policy anniversary preceding the Life Insured’s 65th birthday.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
ai_summary: The Critical Illness Reinstatement Option allows policyholders to repurchase their Critical Illness Insurance at standard premium rates based on the insured's age at the time of reinstatement, considering any previously applied extra premiums. The repurchased coverage will match the benefit amount previously paid but will exclude options like Death Buy-Back and Inflation Protection. Claims will only be honored for new diagnoses occurring after reinstatement and not for any conditions previously covered or related to those conditions, including specific exclusions for heart and cancer-related events.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
ai_summary: The Critical Illness Reinstatement Option allows for the repurchase of Critical Illness Insurance after a claim for specific conditions, including Heart Conditions (such as Heart Attack and Angioplasty) and Cancer Conditions (such as Carcinoma in Situ and Early Stage Prostate Cancer). However, this option is not available if a Total Permanent Disability (TPD) Benefit or Terminal Illness Benefit has been paid.

content:

If Critical Illness Insurance is Attached or Linked to Life Insurance, the Critical Illness Benefit will not be paid if you are also eligible for the Terminal Illness Benefit under Life Insurance.

Additionally, if the Critical Illness Insurance is connected to a Life Insurance policy, the Critical Illness Benefit will be denied if the insured is also eligible for the Terminal Illness Benefit under the Life Insurance coverage.

ai_summary: In the Critical Illness Insurance policy, no claims will be paid for conditions diagnosed or showing symptoms within three months of the Plan's start date, any approved increase, or the most recent reinstatement date. This qualifying period is crucial for determining eligibility for coverage related to specified Critical Illness Events.

*   Carcinoma In Situ (of specified site)
*   Cancer (of specified criteria)
*   Coronary Artery Bypass Surgery
*   Diagnosed Benign Brain Tumour (of specified severity)
*   Early Stage Chronic Lymphocytic Leukaemia
*   Early Stage Skin Melanoma (excluding melanoma in situ)
*   Early Stage Prostate Cancer
*   Heart Attack (of specified severity)
*   Heart Valve Surgery
*   Multiple Sclerosis (with episodes of neurological deficit and persisting neurological abnormalities)
*   Open Heart Surgery
*   Out of Hospital Cardiac Arrest (requiring cardiopulmonary resuscitation)
*   Stroke (resulting in neurological deficit)
*   Type 1 Diabetes diagnosed after age 30
ai_summary: Section 2.3 of the Critical Illness Insurance document outlines specific critical illness events that are subject to a qualifying period, including conditions such as heart attacks, strokes, various cancers, and surgeries like angioplasty and open heart surgery. Notably, certain diagnoses, like benign brain tumors and early-stage cancers, must meet specified severity criteria to qualify for coverage.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
We will waive this three-month period if:

*   you were insured with us or another insurer for the same events immediately before your cover starts; and
*   you transferred your cover after any similar three month period.
ai_summary: The three-month qualifying period for Critical Illness Insurance may be waived if the insured had prior coverage with the same insurer or another provider for the same events immediately before the new policy begins, and if they transferred their coverage after completing a similar three-month period.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
ai_summary: Critical Illness Insurance coverage ends under several conditions: on the policy anniversary prior to the Life Insured's 70th birthday, upon written cancellation by the Policy Owner, due to non-payment of premiums, if the policy is canceled due to misrepresentation or fraudulent claims, upon the Life Insured's death, or when the full Benefit Amount is paid or reduced to nil (though Financial Planning and Grief Support Benefits remain available for 12 months post-payment).

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
The following conditions apply to Critical Illness Insurance:

*   If Critical Illness Insurance is Attached or Linked to Life Insurance, the Critical Illness Benefit will not be paid if you are also eligible for the Terminal Illness Benefit under Life Insurance.
*   If Critical Illness Insurance is Attached to Life Insurance, cancellation of Life Insurance will also cancel Critical Illness Insurance unless you tell us in writing that you want to retain Critical Illness Insurance as a Standalone Plan.
*   If Critical Illness Insurance is Linked to Life Insurance, Critical Illness Insurance will become a Standalone Plan if you cancel Life Insurance.

If you cancel a Plan but choose to keep at least one of the Plans that was Attached or Linked, your premium rates will change for the remaining Plan(s). The premium will be calculated using our premium rates for the age of the Life Insured at the time of the change and will take into account any extra premiums charged and special provisions that apply to the original Plan. Any changes that increase our liability to pay claims will require full Underwriting.
ai_summary: Critical Illness Insurance may end under specific conditions: if linked to Life Insurance, benefits will not be paid if eligible for Terminal Illness Benefit; cancellation of Life Insurance also cancels Critical Illness Insurance unless retained as a Standalone Plan; and if Life Insurance is canceled, the Critical Illness Insurance automatically becomes a Standalone Plan. Additionally, if any plan is canceled while retaining at least one, premium rates for the remaining plan(s) will adjust based on the insured's age and any applicable extra premiums or provisions, with increased liability requiring full underwriting.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Section_Title: 2.4 Additional Benefits and Options applicable to Life, TPD and Critical Illness Insurance
content: The following benefits and options are only available to Life Insurance, TPD Insurance and Critical Illness Insurance. Please note that some benefits are not included when the Plan is structured through superannuation.
ai_summary: Section 2.4 outlines additional benefits and options specifically available for Life Insurance, Total and Permanent Disability (TPD) Insurance, and Critical Illness Insurance, while noting that certain benefits may be excluded if the plan is structured through superannuation. It is essential for policyholders to review these options carefully to understand their applicability and any potential limitations based on the plan's structure.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Section_Title: 2.4 Additional Benefits and Options applicable to Life, TPD and Critical Illness Insurance
content:
Inflation Protection Benefit
We will increase the Benefit Amount by the greater of the Indexation Factor and five per cent at each Policy anniversary unless:
• you tell us not to apply the Inflation Protection Benefit to your Plan;
• the premiums are being waived under the Premium Relief Option; or
• if Life Insurance resulted from exercising the Death Buy-Back Option, Double TPD Option, Death Buy-Back Benefit or Double Critical Illness Option.
For information on how this will impact your premium, please refer to section 1.3.
The Inflation Protection Benefit doesn’t apply to Child’s Critical Illness Benefit and Child’s Critical Illness Insurance.
ai_summary: The Inflation Protection Benefit automatically increases the Benefit Amount at each Policy anniversary by the greater of the Indexation Factor or five percent, unless the policyholder opts out, is utilizing the Premium Relief Option, or if the benefit arises from specific options like the Death Buy-Back or Double Critical Illness. This benefit does not extend to Child’s Critical Illness Benefit or Insurance, and further details on its impact on premiums can be found in section 1.3.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Section_Title: 2.4 Additional Benefits and Options applicable to Life, TPD and Critical Illness Insurance
content:
The Premium Freeze Benefit can only be activated if we are charging premiums on a stepped premium basis and the Life Insured is older than age 30. You may elect to activate the Premium Freeze Benefit by notifying us in writing.
If you choose to exercise the Premium Freeze Benefit, your premium will remain unchanged, but the Benefit Amount will reduce on a yearly basis at each Policy anniversary. This is because insurance generally becomes more expensive as you get older. The reduction of the Benefit Amount will be calculated based on your age and the premium rate applicable to you.
If you notify us that you wish to apply the Premium Freeze Benefit, the Inflation Protection Benefit will not apply. If you notify us that the Premium Freeze Benefit is to cease within three years of it starting, the Inflation Protection Benefit will then recommence but only if it was applicable before the Premium Freeze Benefit being activated.
ai_summary: The Premium Freeze Benefit allows policyholders aged over 30 with stepped premiums to maintain their premium amount while experiencing a yearly reduction in the Benefit Amount at each policy anniversary, reflecting the increasing cost of insurance with age. Activation requires written notification, and opting for this benefit excludes the Inflation Protection Benefit; however, if the Premium Freeze is terminated within three years, the Inflation Protection Benefit may resume if it was previously applicable.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Section_Title: 2.4 Additional Benefits and Options applicable to Life, TPD and Critical Illness Insurance
content:
You can apply to increase your Benefit Amount under the Guaranteed Future Insurability Benefit for Life Insurance, TPD Insurance and Critical Illness Insurance without providing evidence of your health or pastimes when one of the following personal or business events occur:

Personal events
• The birth of a child where the Life Insured is the parent.
• The adoption of a child by the Life Insured.
• A dependent child of the Life Insured starting primary or secondary school.
• Marriage of the Life Insured.
• Divorce of the Life Insured.
• The Life Insured’s base salary increases by at least $10,000 (this only applies if you’re an Employee).
• The Life Insured completes a post graduate degree.
• The Life Insured taking out a new mortgage or increasing the existing mortgage.
• The Life Insured becoming a Carer.
• The Life Insured has a change in tax dependency status as a result of the Life Insured ceasing to have any tax dependents as defined by current law.

Business events
• An increase in the Life Insured’s value to the business, where the Life Insured is a key person in that business.
• An increase in the Life Insured’s financial interest in the business, whether as a partner, shareholder or unit holder, and the Policy forms part of a buy-sell, share purchase or business succession agreement.
• An increase in the loan liability of the business for which the Life Insured is the primary guarantor.
ai_summary: The Guaranteed Future Insurability Benefit allows policyholders to increase their Benefit Amount for Life, TPD, and Critical Illness Insurance without health evidence following specific personal or business events. Personal events include the birth or adoption of a child, marriage, divorce, salary increases, educational achievements, mortgage changes, becoming a carer, or changes in tax dependency status. Business events encompass increases in the insured's value or financial interest in the business, or an increase in loan liability for which the insured is the primary guarantor.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Section_Title: 2.4 Additional Benefits and Options applicable to Life, TPD and Critical Illness Insurance
content:
The Guaranteed Future Insurability Benefit is limited by the following:
• You must apply in writing within 30 days from when the event (described in the table above) first occurred or within 30 days before the next Policy anniversary following the event.
• You can only exercise the Guaranteed Future Insurability Benefit once in any 12-month period.
• You must provide evidence which (in our reasonable opinion) establishes that the event has occurred.
• The event occurring while the Policy is in-force.
• The event occurred when the Life Insured is under age 55.
You cannot exercise the Guaranteed Future Insurability Benefit if:
• premiums are being waived under the Premium Relief Option;
• an exclusion or an increase in premiums due to the Life Insured’s medical history or pastimes has been applied to the Plan;
• cover under Life Insurance has resulted from applying the Death Buy-Back Option under TPD Insurance or the Death Buy-Back Benefit under Critical Illness insurance;
• cover under Critical Illness insurance has resulted from applying the Critical Illness Reinstatement Option;
• you did not undergo Underwriting when you applied for this Plan; or
• you are entitled to make, or are receiving or seeking payment of, a claim under any life insurance policy with TAL or another insurer.
The maximum amount that you can apply for to increase the Benefit Amount under the Guaranteed Future Insurability Benefit is the lesser of:
• 25% of the Benefit Amount at the Plan start date of the corresponding Plan which you are applying for an increase;
• the amount of mortgage or business loan taken out or increased (if applicable);
• five times the amount of the base salary increase (if applicable); and
• $200,000.
If TPD Insurance and/or Critical Illness Insurance is Attached to Life Insurance, the Benefit Amount for TPD Insurance and/or Critical Illness Insurance after the increase under the Guaranteed Future Insurability Benefit cannot exceed the Life Insurance Benefit Amount.
The total maximum amount for all increases under the Guaranteed Future Insurability Benefit cannot exceed the lesser of:
• the Benefit Amount at the Plan start date; or
• $1,000,000.
If the Benefit Amount has been increased using the Guaranteed Future Insurability Benefit, the total cover (including cover with TAL and any other organisation) must not exceed:
• $3,000,000 for Life Insurance;
• $3,000,000 for TPD Insurance; and
• $2,000,000 for Critical Illness Insurance.
During the first six months after exercising the Guaranteed Future Insurability Benefit, the increased portion of the Benefit Amount will only be paid in the event of the Life Insured suffering:
• Accidental death;
• TPD caused by Accident; or
• any of the listed Critical Illness Events caused by Accident.
ai_summary: The Guaranteed Future Insurability Benefit allows policyholders to increase their coverage under specific conditions, including applying within 30 days of a qualifying event and providing evidence of that event. Limitations include a maximum increase of 25% of the original benefit or $200,000, and total increases cannot exceed $1,000,000. The benefit can only be exercised once every 12 months and is not available if certain conditions apply, such as premium waivers or existing claims. Additionally, any increase in coverage is subject to a six-month waiting period for certain events. Overall, total coverage limits are set at $3,000,000 for Life and TPD Insurance and $2,000,000 for Critical Illness Insurance.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Section_Title: 2.4 Additional Benefits and Options applicable to Life, TPD and Critical Illness Insurance
content:
Not available when structured through superannuation.
If we pay 100% of the Benefit Amount under Life Insurance, Critical Illness Insurance or TPD Insurance, we will reimburse the costs associated with the preparation of a financial plan by a financial adviser for the person(s) to whom we paid 100% of the Benefit Amount, or to their Immediate Family Member.
The following conditions apply to the Financial Planning Benefit:
• the maximum amount payable under the Financial Planning Benefit is $5,000 and this amount will only be paid once per Life Insured across all policies issued by us in respect of that Life Insured;
• the Financial Planning Benefit is only payable for the reimbursement of fees actually paid to the financial adviser for the preparation of the financial plan where the fees were paid by the person(s) to whom we paid 100% of the Benefit Amount, or by their Immediate Family Member;
• we must receive evidence which (in our reasonable opinion) establishes the financial planning advice received and the financial plan must be received within 12 months of 100% of the Benefit Amount being paid; and
• the financial adviser who provides the financial plan must be an Australian Financial Services Licensee or an Authorised Representative of an Australian Financial Services Licensee.
ai_summary: The Financial Planning Benefit, applicable to Life, TPD, and Critical Illness Insurance, reimburses up to $5,000 for financial planning costs incurred by beneficiaries after a 100% Benefit Amount payout, provided the plan is prepared by a qualified Australian Financial Services Licensee. This benefit is limited to one payment per Life Insured, requires evidence of fees paid, and must be claimed within 12 months of the payout. Note that this benefit is not available when the insurance is structured through superannuation.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Section_Title: 2.4 Additional Benefits and Options applicable to Life, TPD and Critical Illness Insurance
content:
Not available when structured through superannuation.
If we pay 100% of the Terminal Illness Benefit, TPD Benefit or Critical Illness Benefit, we will reimburse the accommodation costs of the Life Insured’s Immediate Family Member up to a maximum of $250 per day, for a maximum of 14 days for each day:
• the Life Insured is Bed Confined due to the reason for which we paid 100% of the Terminal Illness Benefit, TPD Benefit or Critical Illness Benefit;
• the Life Insured is Bed Confined more than 100 kilometres from their usual place of residence; and
• the Immediate Family Member remains away from their home, having been required to travel more than 100 kilometres from their usual place of residence to be with the Life Insured.
The following conditions also apply to the Long Distance Accommodation Benefit:
• This benefit must be claimed within six weeks of the Terminal Illness Benefit, TPD Benefit or Critical Illness Benefit being paid in full (100% of the Benefit Amount).
• You must provide evidence which (in our reasonable opinion) establishes the Life Insured’s Bed Confinement and payment of the accommodation costs.
• If the Life Insured is eligible for this benefit and there is more than one Plan, we will only pay up to a maximum of $250 per day, across all Plans.
ai_summary: The Long Distance Accommodation Benefit provides reimbursement of up to $250 per day for a maximum of 14 days for accommodation costs incurred by an Immediate Family Member of the Life Insured, if the Life Insured is Bed Confined due to a condition qualifying for the full payment of Terminal Illness, TPD, or Critical Illness Benefits and is located more than 100 kilometers from their usual residence. This benefit is not available if the insurance is structured through superannuation and must be claimed within six weeks of the benefit payment, with evidence of Bed Confinement and accommodation costs required. If multiple plans are held, the total reimbursement is capped at $250 per day across all plans.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Section_Title: 2.4 Additional Benefits and Options applicable to Life, TPD and Critical Illness Insurance
content:
This benefit is not available when structured through superannuation.
If we pay 100% of the Benefit Amount under Life Insurance, Critical Illness Insurance, or TPD Insurance, we will reimburse the costs of up to three grief counselling sessions for the Life Insured, and/or an Immediate Family Member with a counsellor approved by us, acting reasonably (the counsellor should be competent, recognised and appropriately qualified to provide the support). The maximum total amount we will reimburse under the Grief Support Benefit for the Life Insured is $1,000.
This benefit must be exercised within 12 months of 100% of the Benefit Amount being paid.
ai_summary: The Grief Support Benefit provides reimbursement for up to three grief counselling sessions for the Life Insured or an Immediate Family Member, following the payment of 100% of the Benefit Amount under Life, TPD, or Critical Illness Insurance, with a maximum reimbursement of $1,000. This benefit is not available if the insurance is structured through superannuation and must be claimed within 12 months of the benefit payment, with the counsellor requiring approval from the insurer.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Section_Title: 2.4 Additional Benefits and Options applicable to Life, TPD and Critical Illness Insurance
content:
A three month qualifying period applies to certain Child’s Critical Illness Events. See Section 2.5.2 for details.
The following conditions apply to the Child’s Critical Illness Benefit:
• The child must be financially dependent on the Policy Owner.
• The child’s age at their next birthday must be between two and 19.
• This benefit will only be paid once for an individual child across all Life Insurance, TPD Insurance or Critical Illness Insurance Plans issued by us.
• This benefit is only payable once under each Plan.
• This benefit is not payable on a Critical Illness Event which occurred, was diagnosed, or signs and symptoms leading to the diagnosis became apparent on or before the child’s first birthday.
• This benefit is not payable on a Child’s Critical Illness Event which occurred, was diagnosed, or signs and symptoms leading to the diagnosis became apparent before the Plan or Policy start date.
