ai_summary: Section 9 of the insurance document defines several medical conditions relevant for coverage, including permanent congenital blindness, which is the total and irreversible loss of sight in both eyes confirmed by a specialist; congenital and permanent deafness, characterized by profound hearing loss in both ears with specific auditory thresholds; and permanent dementia, diagnosed by a neurologist or geriatrician, requiring cognitive impairment evidence. Additionally, it includes definitions for coronary artery bypass surgery and diagnosed benign brain tumors, emphasizing the necessity of specialist confirmation for these conditions to qualify for insurance benefits.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
The following are not covered:
• A rise in biological markers because of an elective percutaneous procedure for coronary artery disease.
• Other acute coronary syndromes including but not limited to angina pectoris.
ai_summary: Section 9 outlines exclusions from coverage, specifying that increases in biological markers resulting from elective percutaneous procedures for coronary artery disease and other acute coronary syndromes, such as angina pectoris, are not covered under the policy.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: Heart Valve Surgery means surgery to replace or repair a cardiac valve because of a cardiac valve abnormality or other cardiac defects.
ai_summary: Heart Valve Surgery refers to the medical procedure involving the replacement or repair of a cardiac valve due to abnormalities or defects. This definition is crucial for insurance coverage, as it outlines the specific circumstances under which such surgeries may be eligible for benefits.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: Hydatidiform Mole means abnormal fertilisation which results in abnormal development and proliferation of placental tissue in the absence of normal embryonic development confirmed by histopathological evidence.
ai_summary: A Hydatidiform Mole is defined as an abnormal fertilization leading to the excessive growth of placental tissue without normal embryonic development, as confirmed by histopathological evidence. This definition is critical in insurance contexts for determining coverage related to complications arising from such conditions.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Subheading: Idiopathic Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension (of specified severity)
content: Idiopathic Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension (of specified severity) means idiopathic pulmonary arterial hypertension with substantial right ventricular enlargement established by investigations including cardiac catheterisation, resulting in physical permanent impairment to the degree of at least Class 3 of New York Heart Association classification of cardiac impairment. The condition must be diagnosed by an appropriate specialist Medical Practitioner.
ai_summary: Idiopathic Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension (of specified severity) is defined as a condition characterized by significant right ventricular enlargement, confirmed through cardiac catheterization, leading to permanent physical impairment classified as at least Class 3 by the New York Heart Association. A diagnosis must be made by a qualified specialist Medical Practitioner to meet insurance criteria.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Subheading: Loss of use of a Single Limb (permanent)
content: Loss of use of a Single Limb (permanent) means the total and irrecoverable loss of use of one Limb.
ai_summary: "Loss of use of a Single Limb (permanent)" refers to the complete and irreversible inability to use one limb, qualifying for specific insurance benefits related to permanent disability. This definition is crucial for determining eligibility for claims under policies that cover permanent loss of function.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Subheading: Loss of Hearing in One Ear (permanent)
content:
Loss of Hearing in One Ear (permanent) means:
• the irrecoverable profound loss of all hearing in one ear, resulting in an auditory threshold of 91 decibels or greater, averaged at frequencies 500, 1000 and 3000 hertz, both natural and assisted, as a result of Sickness or Injury; or
• the irrecoverable profound loss of hearing (resulting in an auditory threshold of 91 decibels or greater, averaged at frequencies 500, 1000 and 3000 hertz) as a result of Sickness or Injury, requiring the Life Insured to undergo cochlear implantation (includes unilateral or bilateral implantation).
The condition must be diagnosed by an appropriate specialist Medical Practitioner.
ai_summary: Loss of Hearing in One Ear (permanent) is defined as an irreversible profound hearing loss in one ear, with an auditory threshold of 91 decibels or greater, averaged at frequencies of 500, 1000, and 3000 hertz, due to Sickness or Injury. This includes cases requiring cochlear implantation, and the diagnosis must be confirmed by a qualified specialist Medical Practitioner.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
Loss of Independent Existence (permanent) means that solely because of Sickness or Injury, the Life Insured:
• is totally and permanently unable to perform at least two of the five Activities of Daily Living without the physical assistance of another person; or
• suffers permanent Significant Cognitive Impairment.
ai_summary: Loss of Independent Existence (permanent) refers to a situation where, due to Sickness or Injury, the Life Insured is either completely and permanently unable to perform at least two of the five Activities of Daily Living without assistance from another person or experiences permanent Significant Cognitive Impairment. This definition is crucial for determining eligibility for benefits under the insurance policy.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: Loss of use of Limbs (permanent) means the total and irrecoverable loss of use of two or more Limbs.
ai_summary: "Loss of use of Limbs (permanent)" refers to the complete and irreversible inability to use two or more limbs, qualifying for specific insurance benefits related to permanent disability. This definition is crucial for determining eligibility for claims under policies that cover permanent loss of function.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Subheading: Loss of Sight in One Eye (permanent)
content: Loss of Sight in One Eye (permanent) means the permanent and irrecoverable loss of sight (whether aided or unaided) in one eye, because of Sickness or Injury to the extent that visual acuity in the eye, on a Snellen Scale after correction by a suitable lens is less than 6/60, or to the extent that the visual field is reduced to 20 degrees or less of arc.
ai_summary: Loss of Sight in One Eye (permanent) is defined as the irreversible loss of vision in one eye due to Sickness or Injury, where visual acuity is less than 6/60 on the Snellen Scale, even with corrective lenses, or where the visual field is restricted to 20 degrees or less. This definition is crucial for determining eligibility for insurance benefits related to vision impairment.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: Loss of Speech (permanent) means the total and irrecoverable loss of the ability to produce intelligible speech, because of permanent damage to the larynx or its nerve supply or to the speech centres of the brain, due to Sickness or Injury.
ai_summary: Loss of Speech (permanent) is defined as the complete and irreversible inability to produce understandable speech, resulting from permanent damage to the larynx, its nerve supply, or the brain's speech centers due to a covered Sickness or Injury. This definition is crucial for determining eligibility for benefits related to permanent speech loss under the insurance policy.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
ai_summary: Lupus (of specified severity) is defined for insurance purposes as a condition diagnosed by a qualified Medical Practitioner, adhering to the diagnostic criteria set by the American College of Rheumatology or Systemic Lupus International Collaborating Clinics. The diagnosis must include pathological evidence and demonstrate involvement of one of the following systems: cardiac, pulmonary, nervous, or renal.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Subheading: Major Head Trauma (with permanent neurological deficit)
content:
Major Head Trauma (with permanent neurological deficit) means Accidental head Injury resulting in neurological deficit causing:
• permanent Whole Person Impairment of at least 25%; or
• the Life Insured or Child Insured being totally and permanently unable to perform any one of the Activities of Daily Living.
ai_summary: Major Head Trauma (with permanent neurological deficit) refers to an accidental head injury that results in a neurological impairment of at least 25% Whole Person Impairment or renders the Life Insured or Child Insured totally and permanently unable to perform any one of the Activities of Daily Living. This definition outlines the criteria for coverage under the insurance policy related to severe head injuries and their long-term impacts on daily functioning.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
ai_summary: Major Organ Transplant coverage includes the procedure or placement on a waiting list for a transplant of specified organs—bone marrow, kidney, heart, lung, liver, pancreas, or small bowel—recommended by a specialist Medical Practitioner. Transplants must be from a donor who is not the insured individual or their child, and all other organ or tissue transplants are excluded from coverage.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Subheading: Medically-Acquired HIV (contracted from a medical procedure or operation)
content:
Medically-Acquired HIV (contracted from a medical procedure or operation) means accidental infection, after the Plan start date, with the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) where the virus was acquired in Australia by the Life Insured from one of the following medically necessary events conducted by a recognised and registered health professional:
• a blood transfusion;
• transfusion with blood products;
• organ transplant to the Life Insured;
• assisted reproductive techniques; or
• a medical procedure or operation performed by a Medical Practitioner or dentist.
Notification and proof of the incident will be required via a statement from the appropriate Statutory Health Authority that the infection was medically acquired.
HIV infection transmitted by any other means including sexual activity or the use of drugs, other than as prescribed by a Medical Practitioner for the Life Insured is excluded.
This Critical Illness event will not apply and no payment will be made where:
• the Life Insured has not followed the advice of a Medical Practitioner; or
• a functional cure has become available.
A functional cure is where the Life Insured had:
• been fully cured from the HIV infection; or
• achieved a level of health where the HIV infection does not prevent the Life Insured from working in their Own Occupation. We will make this assessment based on the opinion from the relevant medical specialist and/or relevant governing body of the Life Insured’s profession, if applicable.
ai_summary: Medically-Acquired HIV refers to accidental infection with HIV contracted in Australia through specific medically necessary procedures, such as blood transfusions or organ transplants, performed by licensed health professionals after the Plan start date. Coverage requires notification and proof from a Statutory Health Authority confirming the infection was medically acquired, while exclusions apply for infections from other means, non-compliance with medical advice, or if a functional cure exists, defined as either complete cure or a health status allowing the insured to work in their own occupation.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Subheading: Meningococcal Septicaemia (resulting in significant permanent impairment)
content:
Meningococcal Septicaemia (resulting in significant permanent impairment) means the unequivocal diagnosis of meningococcal septicaemia causing:
• permanent Whole Person Impairment of at least 25%; or
• the Life Insured being totally and permanently unable to perform any one of the Activities of Daily Living.
The diagnosis must be confirmed by blood culture analysis.
ai_summary: Meningococcal Septicaemia (resulting in significant permanent impairment) is defined as a confirmed diagnosis of meningococcal septicaemia that leads to a permanent Whole Person Impairment of at least 25% or total and permanent inability of the Life Insured to perform any one of the Activities of Daily Living, with diagnosis requiring validation through blood culture analysis.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Subheading: Multiple Sclerosis (with multiple episodes of neurological deficit and persisting neurological abnormalities)
content:
Multiple Sclerosis (with multiple episodes of neurological deficit and persisting neurological abnormalities) means a disease characterised by demyelination in the brain and/or spinal cord. Multiple Sclerosis must be unequivocally diagnosed by an appropriate specialist Medical Practitioner. There must be more than one episode of well-defined neurological deficit with persisting neurological abnormalities.
Neurological investigations such as lumbar puncture, MRI (Magnetic Resonance Imaging) evidence of lesions in the central nervous system, evoked visual responses, and evoked auditory responses are required to confirm diagnosis.
ai_summary: Multiple Sclerosis is defined as a disease marked by demyelination in the brain and/or spinal cord, requiring an unequivocal diagnosis by a qualified specialist. The diagnosis must include multiple episodes of neurological deficits accompanied by persistent abnormalities, confirmed through neurological investigations such as MRI, lumbar puncture, and evoked responses.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: Muscular Dystrophy means the unequivocal diagnosis of muscular dystrophy by an appropriate specialist Medical Practitioner. The diagnosis must be supported by appropriate clinical investigations including genetic test, muscle biopsy or electromyography.
ai_summary: Muscular Dystrophy is defined as a confirmed diagnosis made by a qualified Medical Practitioner, requiring supporting clinical investigations such as genetic testing, muscle biopsy, or electromyography. This definition is crucial for determining eligibility for insurance coverage related to the condition.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
Occupationally-Acquired Hepatitis B or C means infection, after the Plan start date, with Hepatitis B or C where the infection is acquired because of:
• an accident arising out of the life insured’s normal occupation; or
• a malicious act of another person or persons arising out of the Life Insured’s normal occupation.
Proof of new Hepatitis B or C infection must be registered within six months of the accident or malicious act.
Any incident giving rise to a potential claim must be:
• reported to the relevant authority or employer within seven days of the incident;
• reported to us with proof of the incident within 30 days after the incident; and
• supported by a negative Hepatitis B or C test taken within seven days of the incident.
The infection must manifest itself within six months of the accident or malicious act.
This Critical Illness Event will not apply, and no payment will be made if:
• the infection occurred directly or indirectly, as a result of an intentional self-inflicted act by the Life Insured;
• the Life Insured has not followed the advice of a Medical Practitioner;
ai_summary: Occupationally-Acquired Hepatitis B or C refers to infections contracted after the Plan start date due to accidents or malicious acts related to the insured's occupation. To qualify for coverage, the infection must be reported to the relevant authority within seven days and to the insurer within 30 days, along with proof of a negative Hepatitis test taken within seven days. The infection must manifest within six months of the incident. Coverage will be denied if the infection results from intentional self-harm or if the insured fails to follow medical advice.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
Meningitis (resulting in permanent neurological deficit) means the unequivocal diagnosis of meningitis where the condition is characterised by severe inflammation of the meninges of the brain resulting in permanent neurological deficit causing:
• permanent Whole Person Impairment of at least 25%; or
• the Life Insured being totally and permanently unable to perform any one of the Activities of Daily Living.
The diagnosis must be confirmed by structural brain imaging, EEG and/or cerebrospinal fluid analysis.
ai_summary: Meningitis (resulting in permanent neurological deficit) is defined as a confirmed diagnosis of meningitis characterized by severe inflammation of the brain's meninges, leading to a permanent Whole Person Impairment of at least 25% or total and permanent inability to perform any Activities of Daily Living. Diagnosis must be validated through structural brain imaging, EEG, and/or cerebrospinal fluid analysis.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: • the Hepatitis B or C infection resulted from sexual activity or drug use not medically prescribed for the Life Insured; or • the Life Insured achieves a functional cure. A functional cure is where the Life Insured had: • been fully cured from the infection; or • achieved a level of health where the infection does not prevent the Life Insured from working in their Own Occupation. We will make this assessment based on the opinion from the relevant medical specialist and/or governing body of the Life Insured’s profession, if applicable.
ai_summary: This section defines meningitis leading to permanent neurological deficits in the context of insurance coverage, specifically addressing conditions related to Hepatitis B or C infections. Coverage is excluded if the infection results from non-medically prescribed sexual activity or drug use. A "functional cure" is recognized when the insured is either fully cured or reaches a health status that allows them to work in their Own Occupation, as determined by a qualified medical specialist or relevant professional governing body.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: Occupationally-Acquired HIV means infection after the Plan start date, with the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) where the infection is acquired because of: • an accident arising out of the Life Insured’s normal occupation; or • a malicious act of another person or persons arising out of the Life Insured’s normal occupation. The infection must be diagnosed with a positive anti-HIV antibody test result within six months of the reported occurrence. Proof of the new HIV infection must be reported and registered within six months of the accident or malicious act. Any incident giving rise to a potential claim must be: • reported to the relevant authority or employer within seven days of the incident; • reported to us with proof of the incident within 30 days after the incident; and • supported by a negative HIV test taken within seven days of the incident. This Critical Illness event will not apply and no payment will be made if: • the infection occurred directly or indirectly, as a result of an intentional self-inflicted act by the Life Insured; • the Life Insured has not followed the advice of a Medical Practitioner; • the HIV infection resulted from sexual activity or drug use not medically prescribed for the Life Insured; or • the Life Insured achieves a functional cure. A functional cure is where the Life Insured has: • been fully cured from the infection; or • achieved a level of health where the infection does not prevent the Life Insured from working in their Own Occupation. We will make this assessment based on the opinion from the relevant medical specialist and/or governing body of the Life Insured’s profession, if applicable.
ai_summary: Occupationally-Acquired HIV refers to HIV infection contracted after the Plan start date due to an accident or malicious act related to the Life Insured’s occupation, with diagnosis required within six months of the incident. Claims must be reported to the relevant authority within seven days and to the insurer within 30 days, supported by a negative HIV test taken within seven days. Exclusions apply for infections resulting from intentional self-harm, non-compliance with medical advice, sexual activity or drug use not prescribed, or if the Life Insured achieves a functional cure, defined as being fully cured or able to work without the infection hindering their occupation.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: Open Heart Surgery means the undergoing of open
ai_summary: Open Heart Surgery refers to a surgical procedure involving the heart that requires the chest to be opened, typically to address serious heart conditions. In the context of insurance, coverage for open heart surgery may include specific benefits, conditions, or requirements that policyholders must meet to ensure reimbursement for the procedure.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: chest surgery for the surgical treatment of a cardiac defect, cardiac aneurysm or benign cardiac tumour.
ai_summary: This section defines coverage for chest surgery specifically aimed at the surgical treatment of cardiac defects, cardiac aneurysms, or benign cardiac tumors. It outlines the conditions under which these procedures are eligible for insurance benefits, emphasizing the necessity for medical necessity and adherence to policy guidelines for reimbursement.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Subheading: Out of Hospital Cardiac Arrest (requiring cardiopulmonary resuscitation)
content: Out of Hospital Cardiac Arrest (requiring cardiopulmonary resuscitation) means a loss of cardiac output resulting in unresponsiveness and requiring cardiopulmonary resuscitation intervention, that is not associated with any medical procedure and is due to: • cardiac asystole; or • ventricular fibrillation with or without ventricular tachycardia. The cardiac arrest must occur outside of a hospital and be documented by electrocardiogram (ECG). If ECG evidence is not available, other medical evidence that unequivocally confirms a cardiac arrest has occurred will be considered. Such evidence may include ambulance or hospital medical records. Cardiac arrest resulting from alcohol or drug abuse is excluded.
ai_summary: "Out of Hospital Cardiac Arrest (requiring cardiopulmonary resuscitation)" refers to a loss of cardiac output leading to unresponsiveness, necessitating CPR, and occurring outside a hospital. It must be documented by an electrocardiogram (ECG) or other definitive medical evidence, such as ambulance or hospital records, and excludes cases resulting from alcohol or drug abuse.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: Paralysis (permanent) means the total and permanent loss of function of two or more limbs through Sickness or Injury causing permanent damage to the nervous system. This includes, but is not limited to, quadriplegia, paraplegia, diplegia and hemiplegia.
ai_summary: Permanent paralysis is defined as the total and irreversible loss of function in two or more limbs due to a sickness or injury that results in lasting damage to the nervous system. This condition encompasses various forms of paralysis, including quadriplegia, paraplegia, diplegia, and hemiplegia, which are critical for understanding coverage and claims related to such disabilities in insurance policies.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: Parkinson’s Disease (permanent) means the unequivocal diagnosis of degenerative idiopathic Parkinson’s disease by an appropriate specialist Medical Practitioner, caused by degeneration of the nigrostriatal system and as characterised by the clinical manifestation of bradykinesia in combination with at least one of the following: • rigidity; or • rest tremor. All other types of Parkinsonism are excluded (e.g. secondary to medication).
ai_summary: Parkinson's Disease (permanent) is defined as a definitive diagnosis of degenerative idiopathic Parkinson's disease by a qualified specialist, characterized by bradykinesia alongside either rigidity or rest tremor. The definition explicitly excludes all other forms of Parkinsonism, including those induced by medication, ensuring clarity in coverage eligibility under the insurance policy.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: Pneumonectomy means the undergoing of surgery to remove an entire lung. This treatment must be deemed the most appropriate treatment and medically necessary.
ai_summary: Pneumonectomy refers to the surgical procedure involving the removal of an entire lung, which must be considered the most appropriate and medically necessary treatment for the patient's condition to qualify for insurance coverage.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Subheading: Progressive and Debilitating Motor Neurone Disease
content: Progressive and Debilitating Motor Neurone Disease means the unequivocal diagnosis of a progressive form of debilitating Motor Neurone Disease by an appropriate specialist Medical Practitioner. The diagnosis must be supported by ancillary testing (e.g. clinical neurophysiology) and exclusion of other causes by imaging and appropriate investigations.
ai_summary: Progressive and Debilitating Motor Neurone Disease is defined as a confirmed diagnosis of a progressive variant of the condition by a qualified medical specialist, supported by ancillary tests such as clinical neurophysiology, and the exclusion of other potential causes through imaging and relevant investigations. This definition outlines the criteria necessary for insurance coverage related to this specific medical condition.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Subheading: Severe Burns (covering at least 20% of the body’s surface area)
content:
means tissue injury caused by thermal, electrical or chemical agents causing full thickness burns to at least:
• 20% of the body surface area as measured by the Lund and Browder Body Surface Chart;
• 50% of both hands, requiring surgical debridement and/ or grafting; or
• 50% of the face, requiring surgical debridement and/ or grafting.
ai_summary: Severe burns, as defined in this insurance document, refer to full thickness tissue injuries affecting at least 20% of the body's surface area, as per the Lund and Browder Body Surface Chart. Additionally, coverage applies to cases involving 50% burns on both hands or the face, both of which necessitate surgical debridement and/or grafting.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
means the unequivocal diagnosis of Crohn’s disease that has failed to be controlled by standard therapy including steroid treatment, immunosuppressive medication and biologic therapies.
The diagnosis must be confirmed by an appropriate specialist Medical Practitioner.
ai_summary: Severe Crohn’s Disease (unresponsive to therapy) is defined as a definitive diagnosis of Crohn’s disease that does not respond to standard treatments, including steroids, immunosuppressive medications, and biologic therapies. This diagnosis must be verified by a qualified specialist Medical Practitioner to qualify for insurance coverage.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
ai_summary: Severe Diabetes Mellitus, as defined in this insurance document, requires confirmation from a specialist Medical Practitioner that the insured has experienced at least two specific complications due to diabetes: severe diabetic retinopathy (visual acuity of 6/36 or worse in both eyes), severe diabetic neuropathy (motor and/or autonomic impairment), diabetic gangrene necessitating surgery, or severe diabetic nephropathy (chronic renal impairment with a glomerular filtration rate of 15 to 30 ml/min).

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
means, where the bone mineral density has a T-score of less than -2.5 (i.e. 2.5 standard deviations below the adult mean for bone density) measured in at least two sites by dual-energy x-ray densitometry (DEXA) or quantitative CT scanning is consistent with severe osteoporosis with:
• at least two vertebral body fractures occurring before the age of 65; or
• fracture of the neck of the femur.
ai_summary: Severe osteoporosis, as defined for insurance purposes, is characterized by a bone mineral density T-score of less than -2.5, confirmed through dual-energy x-ray densitometry (DEXA) or quantitative CT scanning at two sites. This condition is classified as severe if it is accompanied by at least two vertebral body fractures occurring before age 65 or a fracture of the neck of the femur.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
means the unequivocal diagnosis of ulcerative colitis that has failed to be controlled by standard therapy including steroid treatment, immunosuppressive medication and biologic therapies.
The diagnosis must be confirmed by an appropriate specialist Medical Practitioner.
ai_summary: Severe Ulcerative Colitis (unresponsive to therapy) is defined as a definitive diagnosis of ulcerative colitis that does not respond to standard treatments, including steroids, immunosuppressants, and biologics. This diagnosis must be validated by a qualified specialist Medical Practitioner to be recognized under the insurance policy.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: means a defective closure of the spinal column resulting in a neural tube deficit with a resultant myelomeningocele or meningocele and associated neurological deficit confirmed by a Medical Practitioner. Spina bifida occulta is excluded.
ai_summary: Spina Bifida Myelomeningocele refers to a condition characterized by a defective closure of the spinal column leading to a neural tube defect, which results in either myelomeningocele or meningocele and associated neurological deficits, as confirmed by a Medical Practitioner. Notably, spina bifida occulta is not included in this definition.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: means the foetal death in utero or during delivery, after at least 20 weeks gestation and confirmed by an appropriate specialist Medical Practitioner. Elective pregnancy termination is excluded.
ai_summary: The term "stillbirth" refers to the death of a fetus occurring in utero or during delivery after a gestation period of at least 20 weeks, which must be confirmed by a qualified medical practitioner. It is important to note that elective pregnancy terminations are not considered stillbirths under this definition.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
ai_summary: The term "Stroke" refers to a cerebrovascular event that results in a new neurological deficit, confirmed by clinical examination and imaging evidence of brain tissue infarction or hemorrhage. Exclusions from coverage include transient ischemic attacks, reversible neurological deficits unrelated to stroke, trauma-related cerebral injuries, hypoxia-related injuries, vascular diseases affecting the eye or optic nerve, vestibular system ischemic disorders, and neurological deficits due to migraines.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
means an anatomical defect with severe or total right-ventricular outflow tract obstruction and a ventricular septal defect allowing right- ventricular deoxygenated blood to bypass the pulmonary artery and enter the aorta directly.
The diagnosis must be supported by an echocardiogram, and invasive surgery must be performed to correct the condition.
ai_summary: Tetralogy of Fallot is defined as a congenital heart defect characterized by significant right-ventricular outflow tract obstruction and a ventricular septal defect, enabling deoxygenated blood to flow directly from the right ventricle into the aorta, bypassing the pulmonary artery. For insurance coverage, the diagnosis must be confirmed by an echocardiogram, and corrective invasive surgery is required.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
means a congenital heart defect where the aorta arises from the right ventricle and the pulmonary artery from the left ventricle.
The diagnosis must be based on an echocardiogram and invasive surgery must be performed to correct the condition.
ai_summary: Transposition of Great Vessels is defined as a congenital heart defect characterized by the aorta originating from the right ventricle and the pulmonary artery from the left ventricle. For insurance purposes, diagnosis must be confirmed via echocardiogram, and corrective invasive surgery is required to treat this condition.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: means the diagnosis of Type 1 diabetes mellitus after the age of 30 for which insulin is required, diagnosed by an appropriate specialist Medical Practitioner.
ai_summary: Type 1 Diabetes diagnosed after age 30 refers to the condition where an individual is diagnosed with Type 1 diabetes mellitus post-30 years of age and requires insulin for management, as confirmed by a qualified Medical Practitioner. This definition is crucial for determining eligibility and coverage under specific insurance policies related to diabetes management.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
Interim Cover is issued by us. This section sets out important information about Interim Cover. In this section references to 'you' or 'your' includes the life to be insured. We provide you with limited Interim Cover at no additional cost while your application is being assessed. Interim Cover is subject to:
• the terms and conditions which apply to the Plan(s) being applied for as set out in the Accelerated Protection Policy Document; and
• the additional terms and conditions for Interim Cover, as follows.
Interim Cover is subject to the Accelerated Protection Underwriting guidelines. This means we may be unable to verify the amount of Interim Cover (if any) until our assessment of your application is completed. Any conditions or restrictions that would have applied to your Policy based on our Underwriting guidelines will also apply to any Interim Cover claim you may make. A claim during the Interim Cover period will affect our assessment of your application and the terms of any Policy that we may subsequently issue to you or the Policy Owner. Any benefits payable under Interim Cover are payable to the Policy Owner, except where the Policy is structured through superannuation. If the Policy is to be structured through superannuation, we will pay the Benefit Amount directly to you. If Death benefit is payable, it will be paid to your legal personal representative. For Superlink IP and Superlink TPD applications, any benefits payable will be paid under the non-superannuation Policy. If you suffer a Sickness or Injury before your application being accepted by us (but after we receive your application), that Sickness or Injury will be taken into account in our assessment of your application once a decision on your Interim Cover claim is finalised.
ai_summary: Interim Cover provides limited insurance coverage at no extra cost while your application is assessed, subject to the terms of the Accelerated Protection Policy Document and specific Interim Cover conditions. This coverage may be influenced by the underwriting guidelines, and any claims made during this period will impact the assessment of your application and the terms of the final policy. Benefits are payable to the Policy Owner, or directly to you if structured through superannuation, with death benefits going to your legal personal representative. Additionally, any pre-acceptance sickness or injury will be considered in the application assessment once the Interim Cover claim is finalized.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: Cover will start from the date we receive your fully completed, signed and dated application form. If you are applying for cover through a financial adviser and your adviser has requested that we obtain the answers to the health and lifestyle questions in the electronic application form directly from you, cover will start from the date we receive the answers to these questions. For Income Protection insurance, you must be Totally unable to Work at the end of the applied for Waiting Period to be eligible for the Interim Cover benefit.
ai_summary: Interim Cover begins on the date the insurer receives your fully completed, signed, and dated application form. If applying through a financial adviser who requests direct answers to health and lifestyle questions, coverage starts upon receipt of those answers. For Income Protection insurance, eligibility for Interim Cover requires that you be Totally unable to Work at the end of the specified Waiting Period.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
ai_summary: Interim Cover for each Plan concludes at the earliest of the following events: the designated Plan start date, withdrawal of the application, 90 days after receipt of a fully completed application form, or notification to your financial adviser that the Plan has not been accepted.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
This table outlines the benefits provided under Interim Cover for various plan types:

| Plan type | Benefit |
|---|---|
| Life Insurance | If the life to be insured dies we will pay the Interim Cover Benefit for Life insurance. |
| TPD Insurance | If the life to be insured becomes Totally and Permanently Disabled, we will pay the Interim Cover Benefit for TPD insurance. The definition of TPD will be that applied for in the application except that where an 'Own Occupation' definition is sought the 'Any Occupation' definition will apply to Interim Cover. Unless TPD insurance is Attached or Linked the life to be insured must survive for at least 14 days after the event that caused Total and Permanent Disability. |
| Critical Illness Insurance | If the life to be insured suffers a Critical Illness Standard condition listed in Section 2.3.1 of this PDS that does not have a ¹ next to the named condition, we will pay the Interim Cover Benefit for Critical Illness insurance. Unless Critical Illness insurance is Attached or Linked the life to be insured must survive for at least 14 days after suffering the Critical Illness Event. |
| Child's Critical Illness Insurance | If the child to be insured suffers a Critical Illness condition listed in Section 2.5.1 of this PDS that does not have a ¹ next to the named condition, we will pay the Interim Cover Benefit for Child's Critical Illness insurance. |
| Income Protection | If the life to be insured becomes Totally Unable to Work, we will pay the Interim Cover Benefit for Income Protection insurance. Interim Cover applies to the Totally Unable to Work Benefit and Super Contribution Option only. Interim Cover does not apply to any other benefits or any optional benefits under Income Protection. |
ai_summary: The Interim Cover Benefit provides financial support under various insurance plans, including Life Insurance, TPD Insurance, Critical Illness Insurance, Child's Critical Illness Insurance, and Income Protection. Key conditions include: for TPD and Critical Illness benefits, the insured must survive at least 14 days post-event unless the insurance is Attached or Linked; TPD is defined as 'Any Occupation' for Interim Cover; and Income Protection benefits are limited to the Totally Unable to Work Benefit and Super Contribution Option only.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
The Interim Cover Benefit we will pay will be the lesser of:
* the Benefit Amount applied for;
* the difference between the Benefit Amount applied for and any existing insurance with TAL or any other insurer which you stated on your application form is to be replaced;
* the reduced Benefit Amount that would be offered where, under our Underwriting rules, we would offer a lower Benefit Amount to that applied for;
* the reduced Benefit Amount the premium would purchase where we would apply a premium adjustment under our Underwriting rules; and
* the maximum amount payable under Interim Cover for each type of cover as specified below:

| Plan type | Maximum Benefit payable |
|---|---|
| Life Insurance | $1,000,000 |
| TPD Insurance | $500,000 |
| Critical Illness Insurance | $500,000 |
| Child's Critical Illness Insurance | $50,000 |
| Income Protection | $10,000 per month, subject to adjustments, offsets and limited to a maximum of 12 months |
ai_summary: The Interim Cover Benefit payable is the lesser of the applied Benefit Amount, the difference between the applied Benefit Amount and existing insurance to be replaced, a reduced Benefit Amount based on underwriting rules, or the maximum specified limits for each plan type: $1,000,000 for Life Insurance, $500,000 for TPD and Critical Illness Insurance, $50,000 for Child's Critical Illness Insurance, and $10,000 per month for Income Protection, capped at 12 months.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
The maximum amount payable is limited to a total amount payable of $1,000,000 for any one life to be insured in respect of all insurances, with TAL or any other insurer, under Interim Cover.

If an electronic application form is submitted by your financial adviser and your cover is accepted by our online Underwriting engine, these maximums do not apply, and we will cover the life to be insured based on the Benefit Amount applied for.
ai_summary: Under the Interim Cover, the maximum payable amount is capped at $1,000,000 for any one life insured across all policies with TAL or other insurers. However, if an electronic application is submitted by a financial adviser and accepted by the online Underwriting engine, these limits are waived, allowing coverage based on the full Benefit Amount requested.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Subheading: When we will not pay the Interim Cover
ai_summary: Interim Cover benefits will not be paid if a claim is made under the Interim Rollover Cover Benefit, if the underwriting decision prior to the Sickness or Injury would have declined cover, or if the underwriting assessment cannot be completed due to Sickness. Additionally, claims related to Sickness or Injury resulting from excluded activities, self-inflicted harm, substance abuse, criminal acts, or pre-existing conditions known at the time of application are also excluded. Coverage may be restricted if there is a failure to provide accurate information during the application process.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
The Interim Rollover Cover Benefit provides you with cover on the same terms as your accepted Accelerated Protection application while we are waiting for your nominated superannuation fund to transfer premium payment via rollover.

The Interim Rollover Cover Benefit is applicable where:
* the policy owner is Mercer Superannuation (Australia) Limited ABN 79 004 717 533, AFSL 235906, as the trustee for TAL Super; and
* the premiums are paid via rollover from your nominated superannuation fund.
ai_summary: The Interim Rollover Cover Benefit offers insurance coverage under the same terms as your approved Accelerated Protection application while awaiting the transfer of premium payments from your chosen superannuation fund. This benefit is applicable when the policy owner is Mercer Superannuation (Australia) Limited, acting as the trustee for TAL Super, and premiums are funded through a rollover from the nominated superannuation fund.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
The Interim Rollover Cover Benefit starts when we agree to insure you and have received all the necessary requirements to enable us to issue your Policy (including any superannuation fund payment details).

The Interim Rollover Cover Benefit will cease upon the earliest of:
* the expiration of 30 days from the Interim Rollover Cover Benefit start date;
* the Plan start date as stated in the Policy Schedule; or
* the date you withdraw your application with us.

If your Policy has not been issued after the expiration of 30 days from the Interim Rollover Cover Benefit start date, the remaining balance of your Interim Cover will continue. Please refer to section 10 to understand when your Interim Cover ends.
ai_summary: The Interim Rollover Cover Benefit begins once the insurer agrees to provide coverage and receives all necessary documentation, including superannuation fund payment details. This benefit lasts for up to 30 days, until the official Plan start date, or until the application is withdrawn, whichever comes first. If the Policy is not issued within 30 days, the remaining balance of the Interim Cover will remain in effect, with further details available in Section 10 regarding the termination of Interim Cover.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
The Interim Rollover Cover Benefit is subject to the terms and conditions which apply to the Plan(s) being applied for as set out in this PDS. Please note some additional terms and conditions as follows:
* It applies to a Plan which is funded by rollover and all Plans included in the same application.
* All claims will be subjected to the terms and conditions of the applicable Accelerated Protection Plan you applied for and where applicable, the special condition(s) that you’ve agreed to.
* If Life Insurance and/or TPD Insurance is structured through superannuation, any benefit payable under Interim Rollover Cover Benefit will be paid to the Life Insured or to the estate of the Life Insured as applicable.
* If Income Protection is structured through superannuation, any benefits payable under Interim Rollover Cover Benefit will be paid to the Life Insured or to the estate of the Life Insured as applicable. Benefits payable from the Policy start date will be paid to the Policy Owner.
* Any claim paid because of the Interim Rollover Cover Benefit will not affect our offer of insurance provided you have complied with your duty to take reasonable care not to make a misrepresentation.
* The Interim Rollover Cover Benefit does not apply where a policy being replaced is not cancelled.
ai_summary: The Interim Rollover Cover Benefit is applicable to Plans funded by rollover and is subject to the terms of the Accelerated Protection Plan applied for, including any agreed special conditions. Benefits for Life Insurance and TPD Insurance structured through superannuation will be paid to the Life Insured or their estate, while Income Protection benefits will be paid to the Policy Owner from the Policy start date. Claims under this benefit will not impact the insurance offer, provided there is no misrepresentation, and it does not apply if the replaced policy remains active.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
This Direct Debit Request Service Agreement (DDR Agreement) is issued by TAL (as an agent of MSAL in relation to TAL Super), to enable you to understand your rights and responsibilities as a new customer when making premium payments by direct debit. It allows TAL to debit your nominated account to meet the premiums for your Policy.
Please keep this DDR Agreement in a safe place for future reference.
ai_summary: The Direct Debit Request Service Agreement (DDR Agreement) from TAL, acting as an agent for MSAL regarding TAL Super, outlines your rights and responsibilities as a new customer for making premium payments via direct debit. This agreement authorizes TAL to debit your nominated account for policy premiums and should be retained for future reference.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
We ensure that we:
• will give you at least 14 days written notice if there are any changes to the terms of this DDR Agreement; and
• will keep all information relating to your nominated financial institution account confidential, except where required for conducting direct debits with your financial institution, or otherwise as required by law.
ai_summary: In our direct debit arrangements, we commit to providing you with at least 14 days written notice for any changes to the terms of the Direct Debit Request (DDR) Agreement. Additionally, we ensure the confidentiality of your financial institution account information, disclosing it only as necessary for direct debit transactions or as mandated by law.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
If you do commit to a DDR Agreement, please ensure that:
• the account you have nominated can accept direct debits;
• all account holders for this nominated account agree to this Agreement; and
• that there are enough funds available in the nominated account, on the due dates, to cover the premiums. If there isn’t, you may incur dishonour fees from your financial institution and your Policy may be cancelled. Dishonour fees will not be charged by TAL.
If a premium due date falls on a weekend or a public holiday, we will automatically debit the payment on the next business day.
If you provide us, directly or indirectly, with new or updated bank account details (for payment through the direct debit system), these conditions will also apply to that request.
ai_summary: When committing to a Direct Debit Arrangement (DDR Agreement), ensure your nominated account can accept direct debits, all account holders consent, and sufficient funds are available on due dates to avoid dishonour fees from your bank and potential policy cancellation (TAL does not charge dishonour fees). Payments due on weekends or public holidays will be debited on the next business day, and any new or updated bank account details provided will also adhere to these conditions.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
Please give us at least 7 days’ notice before your next premium due date for either:
• altering any of your direct debit or financial institution details; or
• stopping or suspending any debits or cancelling the DDR Agreement completely.
If you do any of these, you will need to make alternative arrangements for future premiums to continue your Policy.
If you prefer you may contact your financial institution directly to alter, stop, cancel or dispute any debit. If you alter your direct debit details with your financial institution, your financial institution may alter your debit payment only to the extent of advising us of your new account details.
ai_summary: To make changes to your direct debit arrangements, such as altering financial details, stopping debits, or cancelling the DDR Agreement, you must provide at least 7 days' notice before your next premium due date. Failure to do so requires you to arrange alternative payment methods to maintain your policy. You may also contact your financial institution directly to manage these changes, but they will only update your debit payment based on the new account details provided to the insurance company.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
If you wish to make any of the changes, as outlined above, or wish to dispute a debit you can do so in writing or by phone. The contact details are:
TAL Life Limited or the trustee for TAL Super
GPO Box 5380, Sydney NSW 2001
1300 209 088
We will always respond to your query or dispute in the first instance.

For further assistance, visit www.tal.com.au to access the current Payment Authority form. Responses to queries or disputes will be provided promptly.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
This Product Disclosure Statement (PDS) gives you important information about structuring Accelerated Protection through TAL Super.

This PDS is jointly issued by TAL Life Limited (ABN 70 050 109 450, AFSL 237848) (TAL) and Mercer Superannuation (Australia) Limited (ABN 79 004 717 533, AFSL 235906) (MSAL). You should read this PDS in conjunction with the Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document (AP Combined PDS and Policy Document) which contains detailed information about the benefits, options, conditions and limitations of Accelerated Protection.

TAL Super is a plan within the Retail Division in the Mercer Super Trust (ABN 19 905 422 981) and is sponsored by TAL Services Limited (ACN 076 105 130) (TAL Services). TAL Services is a related body corporate of TAL that provides administration services, insurance services and indemnities to MSAL.

TAL Super provides members with access to life insurance through superannuation. Contributions and rollovers made to TAL Super are only used for the purposes of paying insurance premiums. Members do not have an account balance in TAL Super and therefore there is no investment component.

TAL is the issuer of the life insurance product structured through TAL Super but is not responsible for TAL Super and does not issue, underwrite or guarantee the superannuation interest described in this PDS. MSAL is the Trustee (the Trustee) of TAL Super and is not responsible for the life insurance product or the payments to be made under the life insurance product.

An application for insurance can be submitted by your adviser acting on your behalf. Applications to the Trustee for membership of TAL Super are made along with the application for insurance.

Where Accelerated Protection is structured through TAL Super, the Trustee will be noted as the Policy Owner and will hold the Policy on behalf of the Life Insured member. Your interest in TAL Super is governed by the Master Deed of the Mercer Super Trust dated 28 June 1995, as amended from time to time (Trust Deed) as well as the terms and conditions of the Policy. Any benefit payable under the Policy will be paid by TAL to the Trustee. The Trustee is responsible for paying the benefits out of TAL Super. Restrictions may apply to these benefit payments under the Trust Deed and superannuation law. A copy of the Trust Deed can be obtained, free of charge at www.mercersuper.com.au/documents/governance-and-trustee-documents/ under Designated rules.

The information contained in this PDS is general information only. TAL and the Trustee have not taken into account your objectives, financial situation or needs. You should consider the appropriateness of the information in this PDS, taking into account your objectives, financial situation and needs, before acting on any information in this PDS. Information about tax provided in this PDS is a guide only and is based on our understanding of the tax laws that were current at the date of the PDS. These laws can change and the Trustee recommends you speak to your tax adviser regarding the tax consequences of holding insurance cover through superannuation.

The information in this PDS may change from time to time. You can obtain update information that is not materially adverse to you at www.tal.com.au/talsuper. Please contact us if you’d like a free printed copy of the updated information. Changes that are materially adverse to you will be advised as required by law.
ai_summary: This Product Disclosure Statement (PDS) outlines the structure and key details of Accelerated Protection through TAL Super, jointly issued by TAL Life Limited and Mercer Superannuation (Australia) Limited. It emphasizes that TAL Super provides life insurance through superannuation, with contributions solely allocated for insurance premiums, and clarifies that members do not hold an account balance or investment component. The Trustee, MSAL, manages TAL Super, while TAL issues the life insurance product, with benefits paid by TAL to the Trustee. The PDS advises readers to consider their personal circumstances and consult a tax adviser regarding potential tax implications, as the information provided is general and may change. For updates, members can visit the TAL website.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
There are a number of terms in this PDS which have a particular meaning. Where a defined term is used in this PDS, the initial letter(s) is capitalised (e.g. 'Policy Owner'). The only exceptions are 'you', 'your', 'we', 'us and 'our' which are not capitalised. Defined terms include the following:

**Life Insured** means the person(s) whose life is insured under the Policy.

**Mercer** refers to Mercer (Australia) Pty Ltd (ABN 32 005 315 917).

**MSAL** refers to Mercer Superannuation (Australia) Limited (ABN 79 004 717 533) (AFSL 235906) as the trustee of TAL Super.

**Plan** means insurance benefit and applicable options under Accelerated Protection.

**Policy** means the Plans and options listed in the Policy Schedule and the applicable terms and conditions in the Accelerated Protection Combined PDS and Policy Document.

**Policy Owner** means the person, company or trustee who legally owns the Policy.

**Policy Schedule** refers to the legal document that states the Plan start and end date and states the Plans' options and special conditions applicable to you.

**SIS** refers to the Superannuation Industry (Supervision) Act 1993 and/or the Superannuation Industry (Supervision) Regulations 1994, as applicable.

**TAL** refers to TAL Life Limited (ABN 70 050 109 450) (AFSL 237848).

**TAL Services** refers to TAL Services Limited (ACN 076 105 130).

**TAL Super** is a plan within the Retail Division in the Mercer Super Trust (ABN 19 905 422 981).

**Trust Deed** means the Master Deed of the Mercer Super Trust, dated 28 June 1995 (as amended from time to time), together with the governing rules applicable to TAL Super.

**Trustee** refers to MSAL.

**We, us and our** refers to TAL and/or MSAL.

**You and your** means the Life Insured or the person (excluding the Trustee) applying for insurance on behalf of the Life Insured, as applicable.

Defined terms are capitalized, except for "you," "your," "we," "us," and "our."

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content:
The following information is provided to assist you in understanding your membership in TAL Super. It is general information only and is not intended to be a comprehensive statement of the laws applying to superannuation. You should talk to your financial adviser about your personal circumstances. TAL Super provides members with insurance benefits within superannuation. Some of the key features are: 
• Members can obtain Life Insurance, Total and Permanent Disability (TPD) Insurance and Income Protection through TAL Super. 
• TAL Super does not offer a superannuation savings facility that has an investment component. You will not receive an investment return on contributions made to your account. 
• MSAL will only accept contributions and rollovers to pay the premiums for insurance policies held through TAL Super. 
• Membership of TAL Super is for the provision of insurance benefits only. 
• The Trustee may reduce your contributions if it has claimed a tax deduction for the premiums funded by the payment. 
• The Trustee will only accept your application for membership of TAL Super if your application for insurance is accepted by TAL.
ai_summary: TAL Super provides members with insurance benefits, including Life Insurance, Total and Permanent Disability (TPD) Insurance, and Income Protection, but does not offer a superannuation savings facility or investment returns on contributions. Membership is solely for insurance purposes, with contributions accepted only to cover premiums, and the Trustee may reduce contributions if tax deductions for premiums are claimed. Additionally, membership requires acceptance of an insurance application by TAL. Members are advised to consult a financial adviser for personalized guidance.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: You will only be entitled to a benefit if an insured event occurs while you are covered under the Policy, and you have satisfied a condition of release under SIS. The insured events under the policies offered in TAL Super are consistent with the conditions of release. If a benefit is payable under a policy the Trustee will direct TAL to pay it to you or your beneficiaries as a superannuation benefit.
ai_summary: To receive a benefit under the TAL Super policy, an insured event must occur while you are covered, and you must meet the conditions of release as outlined by the Superannuation Industry (SIS) regulations. Benefits payable under the policy will be directed by the Trustee to TAL for disbursement to you or your beneficiaries as a superannuation benefit.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: If you change your mind about purchasing insurance with us within 30 days of the date we issue your Policy, you can cancel the Policy and the Trustee will receive a full refund. However, your refund may be subject to superannuation preservation rules. So instead of a cash payment, your refund may be returned to the trustee of the superannuation fund from which the premium originally came. This only applies if you haven’t made a claim. To receive your refund, simply provide us with a written signed request to cancel the Policy within the 30 days. And you don’t have to tell us why you’ve changed your mind. If you nominate a superannuation arrangement that does not accept the premium refund, the Trustee can only pay the refund to the Australian Taxation Office (ATO).
ai_summary: You can cancel your insurance policy within 30 days of issuance for a full refund, which may be subject to superannuation preservation rules, meaning the refund could go to the trustee of your super fund instead of being paid in cash. To initiate the refund, submit a written request within the 30-day period; no reason for cancellation is required. If your nominated superannuation fund does not accept the refund, it will be directed to the Australian Taxation Office (ATO). This option is available only if no claims have been made.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
ai_summary: Contributions to TAL Super must comply with superannuation law, which governs employer and personal contributions, including work requirements and age limits. The Trustee accepts contributions solely for insurance premiums, and any overpayments may be applied to future premiums, but no interest or investment returns will be provided on contributions. Contributions can be made via direct debit, credit card, BPAY®, or yearly rollover payments.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
content: This PDS provides important information about structuring your Accelerated Protection insurance through TAL Super, the tax treatment that may apply, your options for meeting the costs of the insurance, and the potential risks of holding insurance through TAL Super. If you structure Accelerated Protection through TAL Super and pay via rollover, the cost of premiums paid will gradually reduce your superannuation over time. You should consider your retirement needs and insurance protection objectives when structuring your insurance through TAL Super. Once your application has been accepted, TAL will issue a Policy to MSAL and you will be the Life Insured. You will receive a copy of the Accelerated Protection Combined PDS and Policy Document as well as the Policy Schedule. The AP Combined PDS and Policy Document contains the full terms and conditions. The Policy Schedule will list the applicable Plans and options that you’ve selected and any special conditions that are applicable to the Policy. You should be aware that limitations and exclusions will apply under the Policy. This means that in some cases we will not pay a claim or will pay a claim only in limited circumstances.
ai_summary: The PDS outlines key details for structuring Accelerated Protection insurance through TAL Super, including tax implications, premium payment options, and potential risks to your superannuation. Premiums paid via rollover will reduce your superannuation balance over time, necessitating careful consideration of your retirement and insurance needs. Upon acceptance of your application, TAL will issue a Policy to MSAL, and you will receive the Accelerated Protection Combined PDS, Policy Document, and Policy Schedule, which detail the terms, conditions, and any applicable limitations or exclusions that may affect claims.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Subheading: Payment of insurance premiums by rollover
content:
• If you are funding your insurance premiums from another superannuation account, you should ensure that the cost of premiums do not erode your retirement savings.
• Some superannuation funds are prevented from making rollovers to pay for insurance cover through superannuation – you should check whether your superannuation fund is able to pay a rollover.
ai_summary: When funding insurance premiums through a rollover from another superannuation account, it is crucial to ensure that the premium costs do not diminish your retirement savings. Additionally, confirm that your superannuation fund permits rollovers for insurance coverage, as some funds may have restrictions on this practice.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
ai_summary: This section emphasizes the complexity of superannuation laws and advises individuals to seek independent tax advice regarding the implications of joining and maintaining insurance cover through TAL Super. It also highlights that changes in personal circumstances may affect the tax treatment of contributions and payments associated with TAL Super.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Subheading: Risks of holding insurance through superannuation
content:
There are risks you should consider before deciding to hold insurance through superannuation, including:
• Except for Income Protection benefits, a benefit paid from TAL Super is a superannuation benefit for tax purposes and it may be subject to more tax than would otherwise apply if the benefit was paid from the same insurance held outside of superannuation.
• Limits apply to the amount you can contribute to superannuation each year.
• Where you choose to pay premiums by rollover from another superannuation fund, your retirement savings will be reduced so that you will have less available to you on retirement than otherwise would have been the case.
• Taxation or SIS laws may change in the future, altering the suitability of holding insurance in superannuation.
• Any contributions you make to TAL Super in order to pay premiums will reduce the amount you may be able to contribute to other superannuation accounts you hold for retirement savings purposes.
ai_summary: Holding insurance through TAL Super presents several risks, including potential higher tax implications on benefits, annual contribution limits, and reduced retirement savings if premiums are paid via rollover. Additionally, future changes in taxation or SIS laws could affect the viability of this insurance arrangement, and contributions made for premiums may limit the amount available for other superannuation accounts.

Document_Name: Accelerated Protection Combined Product Disclosure Statement and Policy Document
Section_Title: Structuring Accelerated Protection through TAL Super
content:
When you structure Accelerated Protection through TAL Super, your Policy is owned by the Trustee under TAL Super in the Mercer Super Trust. The Mercer Super Trust is a regulated superannuation fund regulated by the Australian Prudential Regulation Authority (APRA) under the Superannuation Industry (Supervision) Act 1993 (Cth). Mercer pays for the Trustee’s costs of running TAL Super. TAL makes payments to Mercer towards the costs of running TAL Super. These costs are not an additional cost to you.
TAL Super is governed by the Trust Deed. The Trustee can amend these governing rules at any time if superannuation law permits.
Under the Trust Deed, the Trustee is not generally liable to you for any act or omission other than where it has failed to act honestly or has intentionally and/or recklessly failed to exercise the degree of due care and diligence that it was required to exercise.
The Trustee has the right to indemnity from TAL Super for all liabilities it may incur, unless prevented by superannuation law.
Once you are a member of TAL Super and TAL has agreed to issue the cover, the Trustee will be the Policy Owner and you will then be the Life Insured. You will not have an accumulation account in TAL Super, as the Trustee will immediately pay all contributions and rollovers received for you to the Mercer Super Trust (TAL Super) Application Moneys Account to pay your Accelerated Protection insurance premiums. Your membership of TAL Super only provides insurance benefits.
The Trustee may reduce your contributions if it is able to claim a tax deduction for the premiums funded by that payment and the contributions are not assessable income to the fund. To reflect the most common tax outcome to TAL Super, the Trustee will assume:
• you will be claiming a tax deduction for any personal contributions you make. This means we will assume that 15% tax will be payable on the contribution and the premium funded by your contribution will be deductible, resulting in no net tax impact for TAL Super; and
• any rollover you make is non-taxable, meaning that no tax is payable on the rollover, but the premium funded by the rollover is deductible to TAL Super for tax purposes, so there will be a net 15% tax impact; i.e. your rollover will only need to fund 85% of the premium.
It’s not possible to later adjust those outcomes to reflect your individual tax circumstances. These outcomes do not change the premiums paid or the amount of cover.
ai_summary: Structuring Accelerated Protection through TAL Super means your insurance policy is owned by the Trustee under the Mercer Super Trust, a regulated superannuation fund. The Trustee is not liable for actions unless they fail to act honestly or with due care, and they can amend governing rules as permitted by law. Contributions and rollovers are directed to pay insurance premiums, with tax deductions assumed for personal contributions and rollovers, resulting in a net 15% tax impact on rollovers. Membership provides only insurance benefits, with no accumulation account in TAL Super, and the premium amounts remain unchanged regardless of individual tax circumstances.

content: The first step in the joining process is for your financial adviser to submit your application. If your application for insurance is accepted by TAL, and the Trustee is able to accept contributions or rollovers for you, you will then become a member of TAL Super.
ai_summary: To join TAL Super, your financial adviser must first submit your application for insurance. Upon acceptance by TAL and the Trustee's ability to accept contributions or rollovers, you will officially become a member of TAL Super, enabling you to access its benefits.
